story:
Hello, friends, former (and future) photography workshop students, fellow photographers and anyone else who just happens to arrive on this page:

    I will get right to the story of what happened and how you can help, and how I will thank you for helping:

    Two weeks ago I parked my truck with a Leer shell at the Jackson, WY, Albertsons parking lot so that I could take a bus to the Jackson Hole Ski mountain and work my first day with the Adaptive Ski program.

     Why did I park there? It's a popular local choice to avoid the 15 minute drive to the ski area and paying (and hunting!) for parking at the usually crowded resort, its a very public, and seemingly 'safe' place to park, etc. But sometimes these very public places are the easiest place for thieves to work, I have begun to understand.

     Well I took a duffle bag with necessary gear for the day with me and left behind a Jansport ski pack still packed from a backcountry excursion the day before, with the following items:


1:   My 2014 Canon 70D with a  Canon 18-135mm lens in it. Value: $1350.00

2:   A Black Diamond avalanche shovel: $75-90.00

3:   A Patagonia Torre ski jacket: $420.00

4:   A Black Diamond LED headlamp: $35-60.00 

5:   Black Diamond Climbing skins: $145.00

6:   A Smart Wool zip up wool shirt... $100

    

   In all honesty, I almost never leave my camera in my ski backpack and in the back of the truck because I simply like having it in the cab of my truck with me for safety and for instant access should a photo arise; 99% of the time its with me. Thus, having left it in the pack, and the back of the truck, was an very rare event. But this is very important: I did lock it the shell, just in case.

  

    I likely didn't even think about my Canon 70D still being in the pack when I came back from the outdoor excursion the day before, I guessI must have been tired. So it stayed in the pack all day in a locked shell, should have been safe, right?

  I returned to Albertson's 8 hours later back to my truck, then went on about my business, truthfully I did not notice anything missing then. 

    And so.... it was not until the next day when on my way to work that I saw a Grand Teton sunrise scene worthy of a photograph, and I reached back for my camera...

     Uh-oh...! WHERE is it???

       Well... I knew it had been taken right away when I pulled over, went to the back of my truck, opened the shell, and: the entire ski pack and the above contents were no longer there.


Apparently, the thieves simply pulled on the locked latch and the shell popped out; I guess it wasn't really as secure as I thought.  I have addressed this flaw by now, but it of course does not fix the very unfortunate theft.


     Well... I promptly called the Albertson's grocery store and asked if they had surveillance video of the parking lot, to my surprise they said 'yes'.  

    

      Yet after filing a police report whereupon a kind officer from the Jackson police department reviewed the archived video of that day, it turns out that their video cameras did not extend out as far as where I was parked and therefore I was, essentially, just out of range.  There went that option for at least seeing the thieves in action. Actually catching them, of course , is a whole other matter.


   The hindsight and lesson here is this: All that extra gear (that I mentioned above as stolen) and the pack should have been tossed into the cab of my truck. But I thought I was in a safe public place, you know? And it was secured, so I thought.

  

     

                                         


    

    And no!- I did not have renters insurance for theft of goods, etc, at all. My fault/responsibility and I have learned a big lesson here.  I have this insurance now, but of course it is too late in this case.

     

   The worst part is that I had just purchased my Canon 70D in the early spring of 2014, total value $1350.00, on Amazon as part of a sweet kit that I bought to replace my old 60D.  Truth is, I haven't even finished paying for it yet, as I had financed it on a special Amazon offer.


                                                       Okay, so:


     There are many reasons why I hope to enlist your kind donation to replace my camera: I have been doing and involved in photography in a wide variety of ways for over 25 years now, including studying it at the college level and working it into my Natural Resources BS degree...  and it is truly an important passion of mine. 


     I could go into greater detail of my over 25 years of photography accomplishments, but that would take up way too much space here, and I am simply appealing to the goodness of you, my students and friends and fellow photographers, for I know I would help if you were in a similar situation-and remember, even $5-10 will be appreciated and useful.


Please check out a few of my Facebook galleries:

https://www.facebook.com/michael.grasseschi/media_set?set=a.2174133912010.2134692.1206678189&type=3

    

       Also, below is a link my website: AND: If you buy any prints through my website during this campaign or beyond,  all the money I make there will most certainly go for the camera!

     Its super easy: Just "Add to Cart" and there you go.. 

     Hey-!-Did someone say "Perfect Christmas Gift?"" 

       http://www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com


      

     Finally, a major reason why I need your help replacing my camera on a sooner rather than later basis:

 

* On January 3rd 2015 I leave for Portugal and the Azores Islands as part of a TV show filming trip, and I wont have a personal professional D-SLR camera to use and document this once in a lifetime trip!

Believe me...if I could afford to replace my Canon 70D and the lens that was on it when stolen before I leave, believe me, I would not be here asking for your help!

    

     So its really quite simple: I hope to replace this camera with as much of your grateful support as I can. Even $5 would help, of course :-)

 



                                            WHY SUPPORT This Campaign:

  FOR ALL OF MY previous 550+ photography students at the Crested Butte Wildflower Festival and in private request workshops, etc,  over the past 20 years (one is shown above) who have gained what I hope have been valuable and useful skills through my workshops, here is a way you can truly and genuinely 'thank me'.

    

     For all those friends, family, and acquaintances over the years who have said "I'd like to buy a print or support you in some way", etc, here is your chance to help me out instead. It would truly mean even more.

    

    Finally, the rest of my stolen gear was almost as important to me in other ways because of my over 35 years in the outdoors (and the outdoor industry  etc); so when and if I raise any $$ above the value of the camera, I will use it to replace those favorite backcountry essentials which had a total value of $700+.

                                                  

                                                       



When YOU DONATE (AND I SINCERELY THANK THOSE WHO ALREAD HAVE):

    1: To anyone donating over $100:  You get a 2-4 hour photography workshop with me. Despite our likely distance (living here in Jackson, WY) we will make it work, somehow. Details to be worked out, I promise.

    

      2: Anyone donating $50-$100:I will be available for all your photography questions for the next 3 months after this campaign ends, by phone or email, and I mean ANY questions at all; from the most simple "Do brands of cameras matter" when buying a new one to "Help me understand depth of field before I go crazy." Etc!

    

     3: All $5-50 donations will get a 'free' print of any photograph of mine from my website or Facebook;  I am not sure how many of you will actually desire this, but it seems like an clear and worthy offering.






Just for Fun:   

 I have a substantial media/photography resume that I you can go crazy with if you want to:  http://www.media-match.com/usa/cv/www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com



Okay its...... Christmas Time !!! and we all need to get going: So PLEASE donate now!


THANK YOU so much for your support...really!

Actually catching them, of course , is a whole other matter.   The hindsight and lesson here is this: All that extra gear (that I mentioned above as stolen) and the pack should have been tossed into the cab of my truck. But I thought I was in a safe public place, you know? And it was secured, so I thought.                                                        And no!- I did not have renters insurance for theft of goods, etc, at all. My fault/responsibility and I have learned a big lesson here.  I have this insurance now, but of course it is too late in this case.        The worst part is that I had just purchased my Canon 70D in the early spring of 2014, total value $1350.00, on Amazon as part of a sweet kit that I bought to replace my old 60D.  Truth is, I haven't even finished paying for it yet, as I had financed it on a special Amazon offer.                                                       Okay, so:     There are many reasons why I hope to enlist your kind donation to replace my camera: I have been doing and involved in photography in a wide variety of ways for over 25 years now, including studying it at the college level and working it into my Natural Resources BS degree...  and it is truly an important passion of mine.      I could go into greater detail of my over 25 years of photography accomplishments, but that would take up way too much space here, and I am simply appealing to the goodness of you, my students and friends and fellow photographers, for I know I would help if you were in a similar situation-and remember, even $5-10 will be appreciated and useful.Please check out a few of my Facebook galleries:https://www.facebook.com/michael.grasseschi/media_set?set=a.2174133912010.2134692.1206678189&type=3           Also, below is a link my website: AND: If you buy any prints through my website during this campaign or beyond,  all the money I make there will most certainly go for the camera!     Its super easy: Just "Add to Cart" and there you go..      Hey-!-Did someone say "Perfect Christmas Gift?""        http://www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com           Finally, a major reason why I need your help replacing my camera on a sooner rather than later basis: * On January 3rd 2015 I leave for Portugal and the Azores Islands as part of a TV show filming trip, and I wont have a personal professional D-SLR camera to use and document this once in a lifetime trip!Believe me...if I could afford to replace my Canon 70D and the lens that was on it when stolen before I leave, believe me, I would not be here asking for your help!         So its really quite simple: I hope to replace this camera with as much of your grateful support as I can. Even $5 would help, of course :-)                                             WHY SUPPORT This Campaign:  FOR ALL OF MY previous 550+ photography students at the Crested Butte Wildflower Festival and in private request workshops, etc,  over the past 20 years (one is shown above) who have gained what I hope have been valuable and useful skills through my workshops, here is a way you can truly and genuinely 'thank me'.         For all those friends, family, and acquaintances over the years who have said "I'd like to buy a print or support you in some way", etc, here is your chance to help me out instead. It would truly mean even more.        Finally, the rest of my stolen gear was almost as important to me in other ways because of my over 35 years in the outdoors (and the outdoor industry  etc); so when and if I raise any $$ above the value of the camera, I will use it to replace those favorite backcountry essentials which had a total value of $700+.                                                                                                         When YOU DONATE (AND I SINCERELY THANK THOSE WHO ALREAD HAVE):    1: To anyone donating over $100:  You get a 2-4 hour photography workshop with me. Despite our likely distance (living here in Jackson, WY) we will make it work, somehow. Details to be worked out, I promise.          2: Anyone donating $50-$100:I will be available for all your photography questions for the next 3 months after this campaign ends, by phone or email, and I mean ANY questions at all; from the most simple "Do brands of cameras matter" when buying a new one to "Help me understand depth of field before I go crazy." Etc!         3: All $5-50 donations will get a 'free' print of any photograph of mine from my website or Facebook;  I am not sure how many of you will actually desire this, but it seems like an clear and worthy offering.Just for Fun:   
 I have a substantial media/photography resume that I you can go crazy with if you want to:  http://www.media-match.com/usa/cv/www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com




Okay its...... Christmas Time !!! and we all need to get going: So PLEASE donate now!

THANK YOU so much for your support...really!

story:
Thanks for stopping by my campaign page! I'm Alex, a sophomore at my local high school, and I'm hoping to purchase a brand-new Canon T5i DSLR camera kit before I go on a 3-week camping excursion in the hills of West Virginia this summer. I would to be able to capture my memories and the beautiful scenery in high resolution.

Since I received my first camera, a Sony Cybershot W55, for my 11th birthday in 2007, I have become an avid amateur photographer. Over five years later, I still use my W55, but even the 8.0MP sensor on my smartphone has surpassed the resolution on my point-and-shoot. Occasionally my father will allow me to borrow his Canon T2i for the day or weekend, but it's about time I purchased my own.

Especially after taking some digital photography classes at school last semester, I would like to advance in the art of photography. My teacher hand-selected my print nearly every assignment to be featured in our upcoming spring arts show. I believe I have the eye, but not the equipment. 

Now that I'm 16, I have both a driver's license and a job. With school and other passions to pursue, I can't bring in enough money each week to fund both a used car (plus fuel and insurance) and a new DSLR camera. That's where you come in. I need your help, and any of it is more than greatly appreciated.

Where Do Your Contributions Go?

I'm looking for $1250. You may ask, "What will those funds cover?" or "What am I paying for here?" It's simple:

I'm looking to purchase a brand-spanking-new Canon T5i kit right after it hits the website at my favorite online wholesale retailer. Pricing for this just-announced DSLR camera is not official yet; it will hit store shelves in April. Judging by the MSRP of the T3i and T4i kits at launch, the T5i kit will be priced at or around $1200 (tax not included). These kits include:

  • Canon EOS Rebel T5i body
  • Canon EF-S 18-55mm Wide-Angle Lens
  • Canon EF-S 55-250 Telephoto Lens
  • Canon 300DG Camera Bag
  • 8GB Class 10 SDHC Card
  • mini-HDMI cable

What Kind of Swag Do You Get?

Each tier of donation includes a personalized and handwritten note from me sent via snail mail to your mailbox. If you so graciously donate $10 or more, I'll be more than willing to send some signed and numbered prints your way. Don't worry, these will be of higher quality than those seen in the gallery and will come without the nameprint in the corners. Contributors will be contacted via email once the campaign is complete to choose their desired prints.

Houston, We Have a Problem

Of course, with a flexible funding campaign, I may not reach my goal, however I still keep your contributions, and luckily I still get to send you my beautiful prints! While I may not be able to immediately purchase the camera kit, I will put in some more hard work at my job, and in time I'll come up with the rest of the funds to place my order for my new baby.

Impact My Life (and My Passion for Photography!)

Any contribution you make will help further me in the art of photography. It would truly mean a lot if you can help make this dream into reality and allow me to continue pursuing photography, bigger and better than ever!

Can't make a donation, but you still would like to help my cause? Please, please, please hit those shiny Like, Tweet, and +1 buttons at the top and spread the word! It would make my day if you shared my campaign with your friends and family on your Facebook, Twitter, or Google+ profiles, even if you contributed!

story:
FJORD 36 ACTION PACK AND REMOVABLE CAMERA INSERTS (RCI)

It started with the grand ambition to make the best all-round adventure backpack on the market that allows you to carry precious camera gear safely in any unforgiving conditions. After a year of design, numerous prototypes, testing, and re-design, we are excited to introduce the NYA-EVO FJORD 36 Action Pack (36 liters / 2196 cu inch). 

Welcome to NYA-EVO, designed and tested in the Nordics.

AS SEEN ON:

 

USER VIDEO

 

ONE TO DO IT ALL

An adventure camera backpack that you can take hiking, snowboarding, skiing, traveling, and climbing, the FJORD 36 is one Action Pack that does it all. Adaptable to exactly what you need, so can you be a smart and well prepared adventurer.

 

PROTECTED

The integrated RCI system is engineered to work with the bag so your precious gear is safe from the harshest elements.

 

TESTED

Proven in the lab and across the Nordics so it won't let you down. 

 

PEACE OF MIND

Not worrying about your gear means that you can focus on what's important, experiencing life.

THE RCI UNITS, WHERE THIS BAG BECOMES SOMETHING REALLY SPECIAL

The Removable Camera Inserts or RCIs are designed for optimal protection and customization. We understand that camera gear is extremely expensive, which is why our RCIs were engineered and tested to withstand major impacts. They were also designed to fit seamlessly into the FJORD 36, essentially, one was made for the other. The last thing you should worry about while on an epic adventure is if your costly gear will make it safely. 

 

PACK IT YOUR WAY

You have a choice between three RCI sizes, small, medium and large. The benefit of having all three sizes is the freedom to customize and carry what you want when you want. When using one, the others can be left at home with the lid on to store your other gear. Every outing or assignment is different, be efficient and have the option to take exactly what you need.

CARRY-ON COMPLIANT

The final size of the FJORD 36 was made to be carry-on compliant with most major airlines. Avoid problems and keep your costly gear with you while traveling.

FLIGHT READY

Our adjustable padded RCIs can be formed to perfectly protect your drone and other video equipment.

BACK ENTRY 

We have design engineered into the bag a way to gain access to your gear in a matter of seconds without taking the bag off. Simply undo the chest strap and with the waist belt attachment secured move bag around to the front, unzip the back panel and you're in.

COMPACT URBAN STATE

When you don't have to lug around all your gear tighten the compression straps for a closer body fit, a more relaxed look and greater agility.

SELF STANDING

The majority of outdoor backpacks cannot stay upright and tip over without support. The FJORD 36 base is made of extreme wearing waterproof rubberized fabric (Hypalon) and was designed to support a packed backpack and allow it stand upright on its own.

FLIP THEM

The shoulder straps were designed with a slight curvature for comfort but also usability. The right amount of EVA foam and density allows the straps to stay flipped in place when accessing the rear compartment. 

CLEVER DIVIDER

The divider zips and Velcros into place dividing the gear between the main and RCI compartments. The separation helps you avoid items falling into the RCI section and keeps the two spaces neatly separated.

EXTERNAL GEAR CARRY ATTACHMENT POINTS

Snowboard front | Tripod side or front | Skis side and front diagonal | Multiple ice-axes | Pole | Helmet | Large drone (helmet panel) | Gimbal (helmet panel) 

EXTERNAL NET CARRY

Easily hold your bulky down jackets with the stretch mesh attachment which is also an ideal place to dry out your wet gear.

THOUGHT-OUT ORGANIZATION

A multitude of pockets to organize your journey effectively and efficiently. A roomy front pocket is protective and planned-out with a small drain hole at the bottom so the water of wet gear can escape. A dedicated laptop sleeve that fits up to a 15" MacBook Pro. There is also a stretch fabric zipper hip belt pocket among other access points, providing quick access to your valuables or other small items.

   

To make an impact, we knew we had to pay special attention to the materials and components of the bag. For that reason, every fabric has been purposefully chosen and each buckle is made to withstand immense pressure. The result is an adventure backpack that is made to last and worthy of the demanding professionals that own the FJORD 36.

LAB TESTING

Drop test | Tensile pull test | Hydrostatic pressure test | Fabric | Shoulder strap | Carry handle | Compression strap | Waist strap | RCI D ring | RCI carry handle.

FIELD TESTING

The FJORD 36 Action Pack was used 12 hours a day for 26 consecutive days across the Nordics. Temperatures ranged from 37°F to -18°F (+3°C to -28°c)

FABRIC 

The FJORD 36 uses Nylon 210 Denier Ripstop with a water-repellent coating on the front and a highly water resistant 0.1mm TPU film laminate on the backside. If that wasn't enough, each FJORD 36 Action Pack comes with it's own integrated rain cover that is taped seamed for good measure. 

 

COMPONENTS 

The FJORD 36 uses highly water-resistant YKK zippers, strength-tested, glove-friendly buckles and glove friendly, lightweight aluminum pullers that give you fantastic control. The Action pack also has a hyper-strong waterproof Hypalon rubber base, which is extremely durable and made to withstand severe abuse.

Yes, this is an extreme adventure backpack, yes, it is a highly adaptive camera backpack, and yes, this is a backpack for mountain bikers, skiers, snowboarders, and ice climbers. More than that, this is a backpack for world travelers, for people that go beyond known routes, for the ones that like to wake up on the edge of a mountain range, this is a backpack for people who want to travel in confidence.

We designed engineered, lab tested, then field tested the NYA-EVO FORD 36 to allow people to go further than they have before, knowing that whatever they’re carrying will travel safely. Grab your Action Pack and experience what’s past your horizon.

The FJORD 36 Action Pack has your back, go ahead, go further.

 HANG WITH US IN HONG KONG

We aren't as cool as Seppe (see pledge below), but we like to have fun and would love to show you Hong Kong. This pledge includes your choice of two FJORD 36 Action Packs, a full RCI set, including a tee and hat. One all-inclusive round-trip flight included to Hong Kong with 3 night / 4 day accommodations. There will be dim sum, a harbor cruise, a drink at the world's highest bar (Ritz) and a hike over "Tiger's Back". 

Along with all that, we will also give you a sneak peak into our future developments and a tour of our factories so you can see how the NYA-EVO FJORD 36 Action Pack is made. If you would like to see Hong Kong and hang out with us this is your pledge. 

SNOWBOARD WITH WORLD CHAMPION SEPPE SMITS

Seppe Smits is a professional snowboarder and has been a supporter of the NYA-EVO FJORD 36 ever since he tested the early prototypes. A Red Bull-sponsored rider, Seppe has won multiple major snowboard competitions throughout his career and is one of the hopefuls for Belgium going into the 2018 Winter Olympics in PyeongChang.

This pledge offers you an all inclusive round trip flight and accommodation at Absolut Park in Shuttleberg Flachauwinkl, Austria (near Salzburg) between the 22nd - 30th of March 2018 (after the conclusion of the Winter Olympics). 

Spend the day with Seppe, then hit the slopes and learn some new tricks one-on-one with the master. Along with the trip, this pledge includes your choice of two FJORD 36 Action Packs, a full RCI set, including a tee and hat. Last but not least, you will also receive the only other Slate version of the FJORD 36 that exists. 

 

GET SOCIAL

facebook | instagram | twitter 

MORE DETAILS ON THE FJORD 36 

For more details on the FJORD 36 Action Pack check out our user guide by visiting our website.

 

We want to thank you for believing in the product and us. We value and appreciate your support and are extremely excited to get the products over to you. 

TEAM NYA-EVO

story:
What makes our Wasp 100-C stand out from the crowd? We’ve combined brilliant and energy-efficient LED lights with our Perfect S.H.O.T. system. It is a simple product built around you, made for real production scenarios. Our totally unique fixture, its infinite accessories, and its smart controls will forever change the way you experience lighting. 

With our Wasp 100-C, you can:

Play with color. Full hue and saturation controls give you the ultimate ability to create an immersive lighting experience with infinite color combinations.

Leverage white light controls. Thanks to our white light controls, you can easily adjust lighting from warm candle light to cool daylight to support productions in any location or at any time of day. 

Accessorize. Our light has a 180 degree spread and is compatible with the accessories to shape light any way you want. Use light modifying accessories to customize your lighting for different on screen talent, subjects and locations.  Create a theatrical spot light or a soft beauty light, a lantern light or a powerful flood—the only limit is your imagination.

Be in control. Control the saturation, hue and color of the light through professional DMX boards, a simple interface on the light itself or via your smartphone app. It’s that easy!

Not only is our Wasp 100-C an environmentally-friendly lighting product, but it is also a practical and affordable solution offering the highest color quality and highest output LED for all levels of production. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles by Hive Lighting, the engineering and prototyping on the Wasp 100-C is already complete but we need your support to help us complete manufacturing the first run of these groundbreaking LED lights. 

Our vision is to bring top quality, high-output, energy efficient, and affordable lights to the creative world. Please pledge now to help us turn this vision into a reality. 

Thank you! 

 

 

WASP 100-C™ FEATURES:

  • 100-240 VAC input via power supply
  • 12 - 28 VDC  input via 4-Pin XLR
  • 98 CRI / 97 TLCI
  • Omni-Color LED (1650K - 8000K)
  • 360 degree Hue controls, 0-100% Saturation
  • 0 - 100% Dimming Control
  • Manual, DMX, Smartphone Control 
  • 5 Lbs
  • 6" Length x 4" Diameter body
  • 5" Reflector face 

WASP 100-C™ KIT INCLUDES:

  • Wasp 100-C™ Head Unit with 22° Reflector
  • Wasp 100-C™ Power Supply 100-240 VAC
  • HDP Lenses: Spot, Medium, Wide, and Super Wide
  • 5 inch 4-Leaf Barn Doors

Use light modifying accessories to customize your lighting for different on screen talent, subjects and locations.  Create a theatrical spot light or a soft beauty light, a lantern light or a powerful flood—the only limit is your imagination.
Be in control. Control the saturation, hue and color of the light through professional DMX boards, a simple interface on the light itself or via your smartphone app. It’s that easy!
Not only is our Wasp 100-C an environmentally-friendly lighting product, but it is also a practical and affordable solution offering the highest color quality and highest output LED for all levels of production. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles by Hive Lighting, the engineering and prototyping on the Wasp 100-C is already complete but we need your support to help us complete manufacturing the first run of these groundbreaking LED lights. 
Our vision is to bring top quality, high-output, energy efficient, and affordable lights to the creative world. Please pledge now to help us turn this vision into a reality. 
Thank you! 









 

 
WASP 100-C™ FEATURES:

100-240 VAC input via power supply
12 - 28 VDC  input via 4-Pin XLR
98 CRI / 97 TLCI
Omni-Color LED (1650K - 8000K)
360 degree Hue controls, 0-100% Saturation
0 - 100% Dimming Control
Manual, DMX, Smartphone Control 
5 Lbs
6" Length x 4" Diameter body
5" Reflector face 

WASP 100-C™ KIT INCLUDES:

Wasp 100-C™ Head Unit with 22° Reflector
Wasp 100-C™ Power Supply 100-240 VAC
HDP Lenses: Spot, Medium, Wide, and Super Wide
5 inch 4-Leaf Barn Doors

story:
Hi there!

Once upon a time I worked in game development, but mostly just writing and localization (organizing translations). These days I'm learning my way around texturing and 3D modeling. I'm currently shooting texture resources with an old Canon A560 using CHDK custom firmware to generate RAW images along with the original JPGs, but the hardware is not quite up to par with the quality I want in my source material.

So I'd like to upgrade. But on a limited budget how do I do that? Crowdfund, and then give away the environment textures I photograph for free!

What I Need & What You Get

If you find the idea of royalty-free images appealing, donate one dollar. Then pass the word along. If I can't do this one dollar at a time, then there probably isn't enough use for something like this. :)

I'm looking into purchasing:

  • a used Canon 5D or a new Rebel
  • a tripod
  • and building some mounts so I can get good head-on shots of subjects, even at weird angles.

What do you get for contributing? Environment texture resource packs will be made available from my site under a Creative Commons license. You'll be free to share, remix, and use the texture resources royalty free in your hobby and commercial products.

If you run a site that archives textures for the community you too will be able to add them to your collection for free.

Each resource pack is downloadable from my Copy account, and all current and future packs will be posted on my website.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, or don't feel it's worth it to you, then share the link with someone you know who might find it useful.

Overfunded?

If, by some crazy reason, I get hugely funded I will split the extra funds between other Indiegogo projects and the Blender Foundation.

So donate a dollar, head over to Mootations.info and grab the latest image packs.

story:
Hello, from Stevie! 

We are students in our final year at university working on our final dissertation film and Middlesex University, London. The last 3 years have been a long journey of learning experiences for both Yasmin and McKenna, who are now putting everything they have got into their final film for their course. 

The Story

Stevie is an 8 year old girl who is blind. She lives like any other 'normal' girl, but her recently widowed father feels Stevie needs surgery so she can live 'normally'. Unbeknown to her father, Stevie is happy the way she is, but goes ahead with the surgery anyway because she knows how happy it would make her dad.  

Stevie will be a 12 minute film set in Liverpool - the hometown of our Producer Yasmin. McKenna, originally from Mason, Michigan, wanted to experience making a film outside of London for her dissertation, and after their first visit to Liverpool felt that it was the right place. They began to look for locations & cast in early November. Since then, the two have been on a second trip with their head of camera and sound, to asses any challenges or restrictions locations may have, as well as rehearsals with the cast. 

The Crew

Yasmin our producer has spent her time at university gaining experience as a producer. This film is a culmination of her skills over the past three years, making a number of small films along the way. 

McKenna, mainly from a cinematography and editing background, wrote "Stevie" with a friend of hers. Her work as a cinematographer and editor has brought invaluable skills to her directing role.

This is our head of camera and sound. Dominika (left) our Director of photography & Sound Designer (right) Martha Luigujõe have worked on a number of previous films with both Yasmin & McKenna. Their relationship as a four has grown stronger over the past 8 months whilst developing the film, and are now working together like a well oiled machine to complete it. Dominika and Martha have been a huge part of the pre-production and development stages of the film, and have co-ordinated well with other departments whilst readying the storyboard's and other paperwork for the upcoming shoot. 

Take a look at our DOP's website to see some of her previous work: http://www.dbesinska.com/

Yasmin & Mckenna have also recruited other colleagues from university to help in other departments such as lighting, continuity, make-up & department assistants. 

 

Why do we need your help?

We are looking for £1,500 for very basic elements of the film. We need to be able to feed our crew, pay the remaining balance for our locations (of which there are six!), pay to get the cast and crew from London to Liverpool, as well as buy two hard drives to store all of the files on our shoot days. Although very basic needs, these may not be met without your help and kindness! 

Whats in it for you?

As well as being able to help the get Stevie off the ground and onto your screens, you will be rewarded for such kindness. Each donation no matter what size will receive a personal thank you from the director and producer via e-mail. There will then be landmark donations that will each come with their own Stevie themed surprise, sent to you when the campaign has finished. 

If our goal isn't reached - not to worry! Every penny will still go to the production, and compromises will have to be made.

You're at university, right?

Yes! This is the crew's final year at university, and our final grade is reliant on this film. We are not given any financial support by our university so it's up to us to fund ourselves. Until now it has come from our own pockets, which is why we need your help! 

Risky?

Every film we have made until now throughout our university career has presented us with new and different challenges. Discovering new ones has only built up our reference list of what to do when any hurdle arises. So, what are some of the challenges we will face?

  • Away from our university while shooting - We have already planned the logistics of our travels and where we will stay whilst shooting Stevie in Liverpool. We are planning our shooting schedule in keeping with where each location is placed (thanks to our two recce's.) We have also taken out the appropriate insurance for all of our equipment, as well as bringing extra equipment (such as camera and lights) in case something does go wrong. 
  • Working with a young child - This is something that both Yasmin and McKenna were very apprehensive about - but after jumping in head first with rehearsals with Ava (playing Stevie) in October, McKenna and Ava's relationship has developed into a friendship, Stevie's character being at the centre.  They will also be bringing Ava to the set a couple of days before the shoot, so she gets to meet the crew and know what all of the equipment is used for, as to not be worried when faced with a camera on the first day of shooting. 

It's not all about the money! 

Some of you won't be able to help us financially, but there are still ways you can help our production get further. This could be by sharing our funding page with friends and family. You could also share our social media pages and follow our progress through the entire production, and share those too! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our campaign. Please take a look at our social media sites, and keep up to date with what we were doing. Send us a message on Facebook if you would like to ask us any questions about the film, or just have a chat!

story:
What are Replica Surfaces and who is the woman behind them?

Mandy Gleason here, founder of Replica Surfaces. Replica Surfaces are lightweight, rigid photography backdrops that look just like the real thing! While Replica Surfaces are brand new, I have a LOT of experience with manufacturing and shipping photography backdrops. Along the way, I've listened to your feedback and have created exactly what YOU asked for in a backdrop. Here it is:

 

 

On-trend designs to up your photography game

Replica Surfaces started with four must-have designs: two white-based and two color designs. Choose your favorites to create cohesive branding for your blog or business. Any two Surfaces pair perfectly together in an L-configuration (see how to get the look below) or next to each other in side-by-side Instagram posts. 

 

Food Blogger? Go ahead, get messy

Replica Surfaces wipe clean with a damp cloth or, for the tough stuff, a spritz of kitchen cleaner. Seriously, I haven't found one substance that stains these things! Sriracha, red wine, or chocolate sauce? Replica can handle it. And don't worry, I didn't let the rest of the bottle go to waste (I'd insert the smirk emoji here if I could).  

 

Rigid three-layer construction

Other backdrops have their pros and cons. My goals? To pack as many pros as possible into one backdrop AND be the last backdrops you'll ever buy. And that starts with their construction. The rigid, three-layer design of Replica Surfaces means they're incredibly durable, glare-free, and able to stand upright with the help of our custom-fit stands (more about those below). Not shabby for something that weighs in at just 2 lbs and 3 mm thick. 

 

Replica Stands: pair your favorite Surfaces to create immersive photos

Replica Stands are custom-fit to hold any two Surfaces in an L-configuration. No more propping backdrops against awkward objects. The Stand's cutout-corner design ensures Surfaces lie flush against each other without any unsightly gaps. Stands will be 3D printed using a blue-gray ABS plastic I like to call "Blue Steel." Did I mention you get a FREE set of Stands with every order of two or more Surfaces? I can't make Replica happen without your help and some Stand-shaped thanks are in order!

 

Risks and challenges

When I launched my first backdrop company in 2017, I ran into delays with production and importing. Now with 100% American production, those problems are gone! I have worked extensively with our American manufacturer (down to the last packaging detail) to make sure we’ve removed all foreseeable barriers to timely production.

Plus, our manufacturer routinely handles much larger orders than ours. So no matter how successful this campaign is, we are reassured we will be able to handle the volume. I'll also be using BackerKit to streamline fulfillment, further decreasing the risk of delays. Basically, I'm ready to hit the button and make it happen!

We have already completed a test production run to ensure all of our kinks are ironed out with manufacturing (see pictures below).

 

Retail

Interested in carrying Replica Surfaces in your retail store? Let's talk about it! Contact me directly at info@replicasurfaces.com. I'd love to work together!

So let's do this, shall we?

story:
Photography, apart from my beautiful girlfriend Ash is my one true passions. One that I have really only started living and breathing over the past couple of years since moving to Calgary in the foothills of the majestical Rocky Mountains.

         

I bought my camera, just a humble Canon 500D about 5 years ago. It was something I always wanted to learn and master but I found it to be extremely challenging early on. I travelled through North America with it and that is where I fell in love. I began like anyone really, firstly with some of the semi-automated presets, shooting jpgs then growing more familiar and confident with it and finally graduating to shooting in full manual in raw.

As I mentioned earlier, the Rockies have been quite an inspiration and I suppose it is only fitting they would not only be my inspiration but also lead me to my demise and eventually to this project... Shooting a sunrise in the Kananaskis Provincial Park, I was set up in my location, watching the sun rise from the east, patiently waiting for its rays to hit the mountain in front of me on the other side of the river. I looked down the river and then heard a giant splash! My camera and tripod were fully submerged underwater. I quickly grabbed it, switched it off and pulled it apart, ripping off my sweater frantically trying to dry it and salvage it. It wasn't looking good. I left it all out to dry and then finally when I got home, tried disassembling it and drying it with a blow drier and rice but unfortunately its done, drowned, finished!

To say I am devastated would be an understatement. That camera had really become a part of who I am and want to be.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My work this year has really taken off. As a part of the Exposure Photography Festival in Alberta, Canada, I was named as one of the 'Top 10 Emerging Photographers for 2014' and have had my photography featured on billboards around Calgary to promote the festival. I was also featured on the Calgary Herald, Vancouver Sun and Ottawa Citizen for my Northern Lights photography. My website NicSharkey.com has never been as popular as it is today. 2014 has been an amazing year.

           

As it stands, I have lost my camera as well as my wide angle prime lens. The cost to replace these two items, especially together is far more than I am able to save on my own. The camera and lens have got me to where I am now and were built up over time. I am trying to look at this in the most positive way possible and I believe that with this huge disappointment, a new opportunity arises. With the money I have set as a target, I would be able to put that money together along with my own to upgrade to a full frame camera and also purchase a replacement wide angle lens. The new camera I am looking to purchase, a Canon 5D Mark II or potentially Mark III would take my photography to the next level. I believe I really pushed the camera I had to the extreme and was lucky to be able to get out of it what I did. The Canon 5D would help me in bringing better quality and resolution images.

My goal that I am working towards in the next 5 years is to release a book of my photographs and this would put me well and truly on the way.

        


If you have any questions or would like further information, please let me know. 

Thank you for your support.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

All contributions that are $250 and above will not only be helping me with achieving my dream but someone else's too. I will be donating $25 for every $250, $50 for every $500 and $100 for every $1,000 contribution to 'The Mustard Seed'. A charity that helps meet the basic needs of shelter, food, clothing and acceptance for men and women experiencing poverty, and works with them to find sustainable housing and employment.

story:
Description: this is a video test to show you quality of the 13MP Camera recording at 30fps video.

 

4K Shots

 

SHOCKPROOF

Description: this is a video test to show you the shockproof features. 

 

 

The PCBs, electronic components and internal memory are at the bottom. A Micro USB re-charging port is on the right side. 

The Power on and Wi-Fi buttons are on the left side.

The Full-HD Camera is aligned with the camera lens escape on the front, near the microphone and the flashing LED. The shooting button is on the upper side of the body.

The metallic pin housed in the upper extremity of the bracelet allow the perfect grip and adjustable closure for every wrist.

 

This simple photo test show differences between 150° wide angle lens and standard lens. 

We take two photos in the same position.

 

 

 

 

 

 

FAQs

What do I need to get Cleep working? 

Cleep is a stand alone device, so you can use it without a smartphone to take photos and videos. You need a Smartphone (iOs/Android) to review your memories and synchronize your content with the bracelet. (Running with iOS 10 or later and Android 5.0 Lollipop or later). 

How much does Cleep cost? 

Cleep is currently being offered with two start special pre-order price: 


- €219 (about $220) for Cleep Camera Travel 8GB, our early supporters, get 20% off retail price of the €299 MSRP (no longer available)


- €239 (about $240) for Cleep Travel Pack 16 GB, our early supporters, get 27% off retail price of the €359 MSRP

 

What features are available?

Cleep allows to capture 4K photos and FULL-HD (30 fps) videos from your wrist with the 13MP camera. Content is synced with your smartphone with the apposite app using Wi-Fi connection.

How many different sizes do you offer?

Cleep is been designed to fit any type of wrist in one single size. 

How can I charge Cleep? 

You can charge Cleep using the micro usb cable included in the Cleep’s package. 

Is the Smartphone included with my purchase? 

No. Cleep is an extra accessory. It is a wearable bracelet with a Full-HD camera. 

How much storage does Cleep have? 

Cleep has an 8GB internal memory and an expandable memory. You can expand memory with external SD Card. Photos and videos are synced with your smartphone through the apposite app connected via Wi-Fi.

When Cleep will be delivered? 

Cleep is currently in the pre-order phase on Indiegogo campaign and the units will begin delivering in Novmber 2019.

Which apps are compatible with Cleep?

Cleep has its own app where you can review you videos and photos. Once you have synced Cleep with smartphone through the app you can review your pictures or videos on your smartphone and share them on many different social network such are Instagram,Twitter, Facebook or YouTube.

 

Risks & Challenges

During the prototyping phase we came in contact with suppliers to obtain quotes and production time for electronic components.

Most of our components are certified to be sold in most of country in the world, anyway some components requesting more time for production and certification for each country, so maybe timings can change a little bit.

We will start the production of the first prototypes as soon as the goal is exceeded so as to fall in line with delivery.

For others production we are already in contact with several work centers that provide us with a production lot more than the number of pieces for the achievement of the goal.

The challenge of the project is to receive a quantity of orders higher than expected, but we are taking precautions by contacting multiple vendors.
story_txt:
Description: this is a video test to show you quality of the 13MP Camera recording at 30fps video.
 
4K Shots


 
SHOCKPROOF

Description: this is a video test to show you the shockproof features. 
 

 

The PCBs, electronic components and internal memory are at the bottom. A Micro USB re-charging port is on the right side. 
The Power on and Wi-Fi buttons are on the left side.
The Full-HD Camera is aligned with the camera lens escape on the front, near the microphone and the flashing LED. The shooting button is on the upper side of the body.


The metallic pin housed in the upper extremity of the bracelet allow the perfect grip and adjustable closure for every wrist.

 

This simple photo test show differences between 150° wide angle lens and standard lens. 
We take two photos in the same position.

 
 


 

 


 

 



FAQs
What do I need to get Cleep working? 
Cleep is a stand alone device, so you can use it without a smartphone to take photos and videos. You need a Smartphone (iOs/Android) to review your memories and synchronize your content with the bracelet. (Running with iOS 10 or later and Android 5.0 Lollipop or later). 
How much does Cleep cost? 
Cleep is currently being offered with two start special pre-order price: 
- €219 (about $220) for Cleep Camera Travel 8GB, our early supporters, get 20% off retail price of the €299 MSRP (no longer available)
- €239 (about $240) for Cleep Travel Pack 16 GB, our early supporters, get 27% off retail price of the €359 MSRP
 
What features are available?
Cleep allows to capture 4K photos and FULL-HD (30 fps) videos from your wrist with the 13MP camera. Content is synced with your smartphone with the apposite app using Wi-Fi connection.
How many different sizes do you offer?
Cleep is been designed to fit any type of wrist in one single size. 
How can I charge Cleep? 
You can charge Cleep using the micro usb cable included in the Cleep’s package. 
Is the Smartphone included with my purchase? 
No. Cleep is an extra accessory. It is a wearable bracelet with a Full-HD camera. 
How much storage does Cleep have? 
Cleep has an 8GB internal memory and an expandable memory. You can expand memory with external SD Card. Photos and videos are synced with your smartphone through the apposite app connected via Wi-Fi.
When Cleep will be delivered? 
Cleep is currently in the pre-order phase on Indiegogo campaign and the units will begin delivering in Novmber 2019.
Which apps are compatible with Cleep?
Cleep has its own app where you can review you videos and photos. Once you have synced Cleep with smartphone through the app you can review your pictures or videos on your smartphone and share them on many different social network such are Instagram,Twitter, Facebook or YouTube.
 

Risks & Challenges
During the prototyping phase we came in contact with suppliers to obtain quotes and production time for electronic components.
Most of our components are certified to be sold in most of country in the world, anyway some components requesting more time for production and certification for each country, so maybe timings can change a little bit.
We will start the production of the first prototypes as soon as the goal is exceeded so as to fall in line with delivery.
For others production we are already in contact with several work centers that provide us with a production lot more than the number of pieces for the achievement of the goal.
The challenge of the project is to receive a quantity of orders higher than expected, but we are taking precautions by contacting multiple vendors.

story:
Now shipping!

After a bit of a delay, we are now shipping a much higher quality and better product than we set out to make.

We are outsourcing the manufacturing of the aluminium case which will improve production time and product quality. While this has increased the cost of the manufacturing, we still have a low cost product compared to many out there on the market and hope to still innovate on the design and make improvements over time.

We have improved the case with a quality powder coat instead of anodizing and have added a much higher powered WiFi module giving the CRF improved range, wall penetration and noise floor level.

The first units have started to ship in early May 2018, and we expect to finish shipping IndieGoGo orders by July.

 

Background

My name is Jack O'Gara. I am a 3rd year student who is currently filming my final year film for my degree. Last year I saved up enough to buy my own wireless follow focus. While it is not a cinema brand product, its low cost, high build quality and simple technology got me working as an AC on a few projects as well as being able to use it on my own projects.

As I used the wireless follow focus system I learnt about these range finder accessories that help you nail your focus when using a laser or measuring tape was not an option. But these where several thousand dollars designed for high end industry, so well out of my range.

That is why I spent a few weeks last year working on my own solution. I created a concept prototype using some off the self components and an Arduino. I programmed it and got it working. After showing it off to a few film making buddies, they wanted one too..

So for the past few months I have turned this concept into a fully working prototype. And now we have the CineRangeFinder. A low cost, but high quality and accurate sonar range finder to make this industry tool accessible to more people like me. 

This IndieGoGo campaign is to make this product a reality.

 

The CineRangeFinder

The product is a small box that sits on top of your camera using a standard 1/4 inch 20 thread socket allowing you to use any magic arm or mount you have with the same thread.

It is able to range from 1 foot in front of the sensor up to 30+ feet and you can set the datum line forward or backwards to adjust for placement on your setup. You can also set it to readout in metric if you prefer.

There are dual quad segment displays on both sides allowing you to see the readout either side of the camera. They come standard as Red but are available in Blue, Yellow and White as an option. The displays can also dim for when you don't want full power.

3 buttons located on the top of the unit allow you to access the menu system that allow you to change the datum line offset, switch between imperial and metric, dim the displays, change wifi channels and factory reset the device.

An optional wireless unit will be made available at a later date that will allow you to get the display readout if you prefer a different placement on the camera for the readout or when operating remotely.

To power the unit there is a 2 pin LEMO socket on the rear of the device. You can also power it via the micro USB socket (not advised, it is there for future firmware updates)

 

NEW CineRangeFinder Remote

The CineRangeFinder Remote (illustrated above) is an accessory for your CineRangeFinder.

It allows you to read the display and access the menu system without having to be arms reach of the main unit that is on top of you camera.

Its 1/4-20 thread on the back allows you to mount it pretty much anywhere such as on a wireless display or even attached onto your wireless follow focus.

The range is expected to be over 50m.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have already invested a lot into this project using my own savings. The R&D and prototyping of the range finder was well over £1000. But that has gotten the project to a point where we are nearly ready to manufacture them. The software is done and I have built a working prototype. I have even gotten circuit boards manufactured for the prototypes.

I'm not looking for any money to go into the final development of the product. This is already happening and should be done by the end of the month. This IndieGoGo campaign is to allow you to fund the production run of the CineRangeFinder and receive one in return.

Expected shipping is May for the first 5 early birds, and June through July for the rest. This may be +/- a few weeks depending on a few factors. More info bellow.

 

Crowd fund product levels/goals.

Depending on the amount we raise will change the quality of the product that we are able to manufacture.

Level 1 - Up to 19 orders.

At this level we are able to 3D print the case and use off the shelf components as well as our basic circuit boards.

Level 2 - >20 orders

At this level we can do a production run of milled plastic cases. These cases are strong and light weight but not as strong as Aluminium. Still a high quality product though.

Level 3 - >30 orders

Fully custom circuit boards and components. No off the shelf parts. Allows us to also make the case a bit smaller.

Level 4 - >50 orders

This is our ultimate goal. Aluminium milled case. Anodised matte black (custom colours might be available) with your name or organisation or logo inscribed on the case as an option to make it all yours.

 

The Impact

This is the first product of what I hope to be many. Supporting this crowdfund and production run in return for the product will also help me start working on more concepts that I hope to bring to market. I really want to help bring these cinema level tools to more people and students to help create better films.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any crowdfund there are risks and challenges that can arise. This is why I have tried to negate as many of these as possible. This is why I have personally funded all the development of the product, prototypes and software so that you are not paying for vaporware.

This means the only problems that can arise is from the production run. And to reduce those risks I have made sure that we have multiple avenues made available for all of the production steps from the circuit boards to the case. This means I have multiple places to purchase components, raw goods and tools as well as multiple places to get things manufactured that I personally is not manufacturing such as the circuit boards.

We are expected to be shipping in May and June but this might be up to a month behind if we face any unforseen problem. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want the product, if you believe that it is an awesome idea and possibly know people who would like it, please share this page with them! To make this as successful as we want it to be we really need as many orders as possible.

Sharing this on social media or on forums can really help!

 

Q&A

Q: Why is the sensor and display together in the same unit?

A: To split them would raise the cost of the product by way over $100 because of the extra cables and connectors alone. Because of this we have designed it to be a single unit but have added wireless to it to allow you to use an accessory we hope to release soon that will allow you to have the display mounted anywhere on the camera or even used remotely.

Q: How accurate is the sensor?

A: Very! The manufacturer specify that it is 1cm throughout most of the range of the sensor.

Q: Does the environment or certain clothing items cause problems?

A: Yes. The product uses sonar technology, while accurate, some environments and materials will cause it to be inaccurate or not even be able to range. This is because the sensor sends out an inaudible sound which bounces off the surface in front of it to measure how far away it is. If the surface in front of the sensor absorbs too much, it would be able to accurately measure the distance or even measure at all.

Q: How much power does the device draw?

A: Not much. We have not accurately measured yet, but measurements we have taken show it takes just over 1W. Enabling the wireless will increase this.

Q: How efficient is the sensor?

A: We are still testing this. On shoots I have have been on we are finding it works best at ranges between 1 and 15 feet. This is where it is most useful especially on wide angle lens. Narrower lens we are finding it works fine at 20+foot, though the reading can bounce around a bit due to more objects in the environment bouncing the sonar sound wave. Anything over 30 foot it is not useful. Mostly because the sensor wont range this far and typically in most set environments there will be too much environmental noise at this range. Manufacture specified range for human detection is upwards of 15-16 feet.

Q: What if you get upwards of 100 orders?

A: This would be amazing and I hope it happens. If this happens we can make the cases to a really high quality. There might a short delay as we will be looking to source better manufacturing equipment, but it will be worth it and long term will allow us to make the accessories such as wireless remote much better too.

Please feel free to ask any questions using the "Ask a question" link at the top of the page.
