story:
Unleash your creativity with Pinout

 

 

Pinout is a small device that plugs to your DSLR camera; it uses Bluetooth LE technology and a dedicated app on your smartphone to give you remote access and much more to the camera. Let Pinout take your photography to the next level! 

  • Remote shutter release: snap pictures wirelessly with your smartphone through a click on the app, voice command, or by shaking your phone. Also supports simple and advanced mode for selfies, time-lapse, star trail, HDR, Bulb ramping and much more. Multi-camera control supported.
  • Geotagging: Automatically record GPS position data for your pictures. 
  • Compact design: Seamlessly blends in with camera. No cable, does not use hot shoe, and no need to take it off before stowing away camera in camera bag.
  • Battery free: Does not require batteries and uses a very tiny portion of camera’s charge. 
  • And,with Loss prevention feature, Never lose your expensive DSLR again!

 

Pinout can control focus just like half-pressing the shutter button. 

Introduction

We believe that digital devices can enhance our surroundings and lifestyle for the better, and that technology should be affordable and accessible for everyone. Pinout was created after we found that many of our DSLR-owning friends took most of their pictures with their smartphone’s camera, even though the quality was much lower, while their fancy camera collected dust. We wanted to create a device to make DSLRs more accessible for everyone—and thus, Pinout was born. 

Pinout is not just a remote control for your camera—it is a theft prevention device, GPS, remote control, and supports HDR imaging, time-lapse, and many other features all rolled into one small, slick device + free application for smartphones. It has features for the professional cameraperson but is easy enough for anyone with a smartphone to use. Like a pin defining spaces on a map, Pinout is a tool that can help you make your surroundings your own through photography. 

 

 

The features

Remote shutter release

 

Make that perfect, DSLR-quality selfies and hassle-free group pictures a reality. Pinout has no wires, and is easily controlled via an app on your smartphone. You can snap a picture with the volume control button, a simple click using the app, shaking your phone, or even by simply saying “CHEEESE” with the voice command mode. 

 

Remote release is a popular tool used by serious photographers both outside and inside for shooting wildlife, scenery, and studio shoots. One reason is because when you manually press the shutter on your camera, even the steadiest of us send a small vibration to the camera body leading to blurry pictures. With Pinout, you can capture that crisp, beautiful shot of sunset you always wanted. 

 

Loss/theft prevention

Expensive cameras are an easy target for theft. With Pinout, you can set your smartphone to alert you when your camera goes 20 or 30 meters (up to 98 feet) away from your phone, with your camera on or off. No more leaving your camera somewhere and forgetting it behind. You can even track the point where your camera went out of range if it does get lost or stolen.

 

GPS

With the GPS feature, you can automatically geo-tag your photos by recording GPS position data of each picture you take into EXIF information, as you shoot. Moreover, on the easy-to-use map interface on the dedicated app, you can set your location to the place you’re taking a picture of. For example, you can take pictures of Mt. Fuji from hundreds of kilometers away and set your location to Mt. Fuji so that all of your pictures are automatically tagged with what’s actually in the picture. 

Automatically geotagging saves a lot of time in the long run and also makes it easy to share location of the shoot when you share photos on social media.

 

 

High-dynamic-range (HDR) imaging

HDR imaging allows you to take better pictures by adding more “dynamic-range” or ratio of light to dark. The same scene is shot multiple times with different exposures and all images rendered together to yield a “HDR” image that is closer to what your eyes see than what your camera “sees”. Recent smartphones come with HDR imaging function but with DSLRs the process is cumbersome as it requires manual editing. Pinout makes taking better pictures of landscapes, low-light or backlit scenes with your DSLR much easier.

 

Time-lapse

A series of pictures are captured at a particular interval and played back to yield what looks like a video. This feature is perfect for capturing subtle changes to scenery or objects over a period of time. Time-lapse allows you to cut through the noise and observe things from a different perspective by manipulating the flow of time.

Moreover, you can also perform distance-lapse with Pinout which allows you to take a series of pictures with interval of a particular distance, instead of time. For example, you can strap your Pinout-attached camera to your car’s roof and drive around your neighborhood to capture scenery that changes with distance. 

With Pinout, you can easily set the interval, number of frames to shoot, and exposure on the app. With the premium function, you can set exposure of each frame individually as well. Once you press start, Pinout receives the command and starts the time-lapse, allowing you to watch videos, surf, or even turn off your smartphone. 

Pinout also offers advanced options with time lapse such as preset for shooting star trails, HDR time lapse, and bulb ramping. 

Multi-camera control

Pinout app can control up to 10 cameras simultaneously, so by setting up cameras at different angles you never miss the perfect angle for that perfect moment. Great for photographing sports!

 

Sensor-based photography (under development)

DSLR cameras have few sensors built-in but smartphones come packed with sensors such as motion sensor, vibration sensor, face detection sensor, along with camera and microphone. Pinout can use your smartphone's sensors to enhance DSLRs’ capabilities. We have some cool features under development but we'd like your feedback so feel free to let us know what you want!

Some features we're thinking of developing:

Lightning sensor: Capture perfect lightning shots with Pinout. Flash of bright light (such as lightning) captured through your smartphone’s camera activates your camera’s shutter through Pinout. You can set the sensitivity at which it activates through the app on your smartphone.

Motion sensor: With this feature on, any changes in your smartphone’s position triggers the shutter on your Pinout-connected camera so you can snap a picture at the moment your phone moves. 

 

Compact design

The stylish pin-shaped design in black and red blends in seamlessly with Nikon DSLRs, adding a cool accent to your camera. The compact size also means Pinout doesn’t get in the way when shooting, and there is no need to take it off before stowing it away in your camera bag. It attaches to  the accessory port, leaving the hot shoe free for an external flash unit.

 

Range

Pinout works with your smartphone at a distance of up to 30 meters (98 feet). 

Battery free

Pinout does not require any battery power. It uses power from your camera, yes, but the amount of power it requires for a year’s worth of use is approximately the amount of power stored in a miniature button battery, so it does not use up your camera’s precious power.

 

Kits

Pinout has many features for everyone from novices to professionals. To make it easier to choose, we’ve bundled features in easy to use kits, all of which come with one Pinout device. The Basic kit is very affordable with functions anyone can use such as loss prevention and remote control. The Pro kit is aimed at more advanced users who want to step up their photography with features such as time lapse and GPS (geotagging) function. For users that want it all, we have the Full kit with all features Pinout has to offer. Each feature is also available individually so you can mix and match depending on your needs.

Compatibility

 

 

Cameras: Currently Pinout is only compatible with Nikon DSLRs, and some digital cameras. Specifically: 

* Pinout (Type A) supports Nikon D5, D500, D4, D4s, D3, D3S, D3X, D2X, D2XS, D2HS, D2H,  D800, D800E, D810, D810A, D700, D300, D300S, D200 and Fujifilm S5 Pro;

* Pinout (Type B) supports Nikon Df, D750, D610, D600, D90, D7200, D7100, D7000, D5500, D5300, D5200, D5100, D5000, D3300, D3200, D3100, COOLPIX A, COOLPIX P7800, COOLPIX P7700;

 

Smartphones: 

iPhone 4s and later generation iPhones/iPads include the latest iPhone 6/6s and plus, Apple watch, and any Android smartphone with OS4.4 or above is compatible. Your smartphone has to have BLE capability to use Pinout. 

 

Our Story

We started our company Zesty 6 years ago in Tokyo, Japan and were one of the earliest companies that acquired a MFi(Made for iPod, iPhone, iPad) license from Apple.  Currently we focus on IoT(Internet of Thing) and digital life. We have developed and introduced products on the market such as an infrared communication adapter, an RFID reading and writing adapter, a visible light communication SDK, a multi-function wireless remote controller, etc. 

In 2012 we launched ZGR, a device to remote control Nikon cameras with iPhone, with the mission to make cameras and photography better. We received a lot of love for our ZGR series, so we decided to make it even better with the Pinout. This time, we wanted to make a product for everyone so we shrunk the size while adding tons of new features such as loss and theft prevention, easy to use remote control, and many more.

But we need your support!

  • We want to know more about you—the user’s—needs. This is one reason why we’re crowdfunding, because we want to build a community and get feedback from users. Please feel free to leave us comments and suggestions on what to develop. Let’s work together to enhance the DSLR experience! 
  • Currently our product comes in two types, A and B and can only be used with Nikon cameras. We have the technology to expand compatibility with cameras from other manufacturers, but we don’t have enough funds to start production. If the campaign succeeds, we plan to make Pinout compatible with other camera makers. 
  • We want to expand and improve on features. We have already developed many free and premium features but there is still room for improvement. 
  • If our campaign succeeds, we can speed up the development and manufacturing process. 

With your contribution you get 

  • 7 USD: Donate and get a coupon to unlock one premium feature from the app. Applicable to Nikon and other brands (when released), so even if you do not have a Nikon camera now, you can use this to get discounted premium features later on. Code to unlock premium feature will be sent by email. 
  • 24 USD: Basic kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera. See chart below for included features. 
  • 54 USD: Pro Kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Pro kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera. See chart below for included features. 
  • 89 USD: Full Kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Full kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera.  See chart below for included features. 
Special for Indiegogo
  • 89 USD: Gold Kit (includes one Gold Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Full kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B.  Limited Quantities. Indiegogo Only.

 

 

Plan

We have worked hard to get Pinout to where it is today and we have the technology and manufacturing process set. We hope to successfully finish our campaign by the end of January 2016, finish manufacturing by March, and get Pinout to the contributors in April.

If we get enough support, we will develop devices for other camera manufacturers ASAP, start the manufacturing process in May or June 2016, and ship the first batch out in July 2016. From our R&D experience with developing previous devices in the ZGR series, we have the technology to develop devices compatible with Canon and other manufacturers. We just need your support ☺

We want to hear from you! Please leave a comment with any questions!

 

 

Packaging

We've produced a convenient case to store Pinout when it's not connected to a camera. The case is small enough to fit in a packed camera bag but big enough to not lose it easily. 

 

CONTRIBUTE NOW

 

FAQs:

Q: Why is Pinout only compatible with Nikon cameras? 

A: Previously we developed a precursor to Pinout that is compatible with other camera manufacturers and we'd like Pinout to be compatible with other brands too. However, we do not have the funds currently to start developing and manufacturing Pinout compatible with other brands while keeping all its features. We decided to focus on one brand (Nikon) to put this cool device on the market as soon as possible, and hopefully use the funds we raise to expand compatibility to other brands. 

Q: I don’t have a Nikon camera, but I’m interested in Pinout. Should I contribute to your campaign? 

A: Yes! Your contribution will help us reach our campaign goal, and if we reach our campaign goal, we will start development and production of Pinout compatible with other brands ASAP. We already have the technology to make Pinout compatible with most Canon DSLRs; if there is demand we are prepared to answer it! Your feedback is very important for us, so please let us know if you’d like us to develop Pinout to be compatible with your favorite brands in the comments section. 

Q: I’ve ordered the Basic Kit, but I want to add features while the campaign is still ongoing. Can I upgrade to Pro or Full Kit?

A: During the campaign, you can donate 7 USD to unlock premium features at a discounted price, so you can add whichever features you'd like. However, once the transaction is complete for a contribution, you cannot change it to another kit. You can also add additional features at any time after the campaign is over at the prices listed in the features table above or at www.letspinout.com. 

Q: Is there a limit to how many coupons I can buy? Is there an expiration date on the coupons?

A: No limits or expiration dates! You can buy coupons for as many features as you need, and they can be unlocked whenever you need. These coupons are also valid for Pinout compatible with other camera brands such as Canon, when we release it in the future. You can show support and demand for Pinout compatibility with other brands and by purchasing these coupons now, enabling us to release Pinout for other brands soon. 


CONTRIBUTE NOW
story_txt:
Unleash your creativity with Pinout  Pinout is a small device that plugs to your DSLR camera; it uses Bluetooth LE technology and a dedicated app on your smartphone to give you remote access and much more to the camera. Let Pinout take your photography to the next level! 

Remote shutter release: snap pictures wirelessly with your smartphone through a click on the app, voice command, or by shaking your phone. Also supports simple and advanced mode for selfies, time-lapse, star trail, HDR, Bulb ramping and much more. Multi-camera control supported.

Geotagging: Automatically record GPS position data for your pictures. 

Compact design: Seamlessly blends in with camera. No cable, does not use hot shoe, and no need to take it off before stowing away camera in camera bag.

Battery free: Does not require batteries and uses a very tiny portion of camera’s charge. 
And,with Loss prevention feature, Never lose your expensive DSLR again!
 Pinout can control focus just like half-pressing the shutter button. IntroductionWe believe that digital devices can enhance our surroundings and lifestyle for the better, and that technology should be affordable and accessible for everyone. Pinout was created after we found that many of our DSLR-owning friends took most of their pictures with their smartphone’s camera, even though the quality was much lower, while their fancy camera collected dust. We wanted to create a device to make DSLRs more accessible for everyone—and thus, Pinout was born. Pinout is not just a remote control for your camera—it is a theft prevention device, GPS, remote control, and supports HDR imaging, time-lapse, and many other features all rolled into one small, slick device + free application for smartphones. It has features for the professional cameraperson but is easy enough for anyone with a smartphone to use. Like a pin defining spaces on a map, Pinout is a tool that can help you make your surroundings your own through photography.   The featuresRemote shutter release Make that perfect, DSLR-quality selfies and hassle-free group pictures a reality. Pinout has no wires, and is easily controlled via an app on your smartphone. You can snap a picture with the volume control button, a simple click using the app, shaking your phone, or even by simply saying “CHEEESE” with the voice command mode.  Remote release is a popular tool used by serious photographers both outside and inside for shooting wildlife, scenery, and studio shoots. One reason is because when you manually press the shutter on your camera, even the steadiest of us send a small vibration to the camera body leading to blurry pictures. With Pinout, you can capture that crisp, beautiful shot of sunset you always wanted.  Loss/theft preventionExpensive cameras are an easy target for theft. With Pinout, you can set your smartphone to alert you when your camera goes 20 or 30 meters (up to 98 feet) away from your phone, with your camera on or off. No more leaving your camera somewhere and forgetting it behind. You can even track the point where your camera went out of range if it does get lost or stolen. GPSWith the GPS feature, you can automatically geo-tag your photos by recording GPS position data of each picture you take into EXIF information, as you shoot. Moreover, on the easy-to-use map interface on the dedicated app, you can set your location to the place you’re taking a picture of. For example, you can take pictures of Mt. Fuji from hundreds of kilometers away and set your location to Mt. Fuji so that all of your pictures are automatically tagged with what’s actually in the picture. Automatically geotagging saves a lot of time in the long run and also makes it easy to share location of the shoot when you share photos on social media.  High-dynamic-range (HDR) imagingHDR imaging allows you to take better pictures by adding more “dynamic-range” or ratio of light to dark. The same scene is shot multiple times with different exposures and all images rendered together to yield a “HDR” image that is closer to what your eyes see than what your camera “sees”. Recent smartphones come with HDR imaging function but with DSLRs the process is cumbersome as it requires manual editing. Pinout makes taking better pictures of landscapes, low-light or backlit scenes with your DSLR much easier. Time-lapseA series of pictures are captured at a particular interval and played back to yield what looks like a video. This feature is perfect for capturing subtle changes to scenery or objects over a period of time. Time-lapse allows you to cut through the noise and observe things from a different perspective by manipulating the flow of time.Moreover, you can also perform distance-lapse with Pinout which allows you to take a series of pictures with interval of a particular distance, instead of time. For example, you can strap your Pinout-attached camera to your car’s roof and drive around your neighborhood to capture scenery that changes with distance. With Pinout, you can easily set the interval, number of frames to shoot, and exposure on the app. With the premium function, you can set exposure of each frame individually as well. Once you press start, Pinout receives the command and starts the time-lapse, allowing you to watch videos, surf, or even turn off your smartphone. Pinout also offers advanced options with time lapse such as preset for shooting star trails, HDR time lapse, and bulb ramping. Multi-camera controlPinout app can control up to 10 cameras simultaneously, so by setting up cameras at different angles you never miss the perfect angle for that perfect moment. Great for photographing sports! Sensor-based photography (under development)DSLR cameras have few sensors built-in but smartphones come packed with sensors such as motion sensor, vibration sensor, face detection sensor, along with camera and microphone. Pinout can use your smartphone's sensors to enhance DSLRs’ capabilities. We have some cool features under development but we'd like your feedback so feel free to let us know what you want!Some features we're thinking of developing:Lightning sensor: Capture perfect lightning shots with Pinout. Flash of bright light (such as lightning) captured through your smartphone’s camera activates your camera’s shutter through Pinout. You can set the sensitivity at which it activates through the app on your smartphone.Motion sensor: With this feature on, any changes in your smartphone’s position triggers the shutter on your Pinout-connected camera so you can snap a picture at the moment your phone moves.  Compact designThe stylish pin-shaped design in black and red blends in seamlessly with Nikon DSLRs, adding a cool accent to your camera. The compact size also means Pinout doesn’t get in the way when shooting, and there is no need to take it off before stowing it away in your camera bag. It attaches to  the accessory port, leaving the hot shoe free for an external flash unit. 
Range
Pinout works with your smartphone at a distance of up to 30 meters (98 feet). 
Battery free
Pinout does not require any battery power. It uses power from your camera, yes, but the amount of power it requires for a year’s worth of use is approximately the amount of power stored in a miniature button battery, so it does not use up your camera’s precious power.
 
Kits
Pinout has many features for everyone from novices to professionals. To make it easier to choose, we’ve bundled features in easy to use kits, all of which come with one Pinout device. The Basic kit is very affordable with functions anyone can use such as loss prevention and remote control. The Pro kit is aimed at more advanced users who want to step up their photography with features such as time lapse and GPS (geotagging) function. For users that want it all, we have the Full kit with all features Pinout has to offer. Each feature is also available individually so you can mix and match depending on your needs.
Compatibility

 
 


Cameras: Currently Pinout is only compatible with Nikon DSLRs, and some digital cameras. Specifically: 
* Pinout (Type A) supports Nikon D5, D500, D4, D4s, D3, D3S, D3X, D2X, D2XS, D2HS, D2H,  D800, D800E, D810, D810A, D700, D300, D300S, D200 and Fujifilm S5 Pro;
* Pinout (Type B) supports Nikon Df, D750, D610, D600, D90, D7200, D7100, D7000, D5500, D5300, D5200, D5100, D5000, D3300, D3200, D3100, COOLPIX A, COOLPIX P7800, COOLPIX P7700;
 Smartphones: 
iPhone 4s and later generation iPhones/iPads include the latest iPhone 6/6s and plus, Apple watch, and any Android smartphone with OS4.4 or above is compatible. Your smartphone has to have BLE capability to use Pinout. 
 
Our Story
We started our company Zesty 6 years ago in Tokyo, Japan and were one of the earliest companies that acquired a MFi(Made for iPod, iPhone, iPad) license from Apple.  Currently we focus on IoT(Internet of Thing) and digital life. We have developed and introduced products on the market such as an infrared communication adapter, an RFID reading and writing adapter, a visible light communication SDK, a multi-function wireless remote controller, etc. 
In 2012 we launched ZGR, a device to remote control Nikon cameras with iPhone, with the mission to make cameras and photography better. We received a lot of love for our ZGR series, so we decided to make it even better with the Pinout. This time, we wanted to make a product for everyone so we shrunk the size while adding tons of new features such as loss and theft prevention, easy to use remote control, and many more.

But we need your support!

We want to know more about you—the user’s—needs. This is one reason why we’re crowdfunding, because we want to build a community and get feedback from users. Please feel free to leave us comments and suggestions on what to develop. Let’s work together to enhance the DSLR experience! 
Currently our product comes in two types, A and B and can only be used with Nikon cameras. We have the technology to expand compatibility with cameras from other manufacturers, but we don’t have enough funds to start production. If the campaign succeeds, we plan to make Pinout compatible with other camera makers. 
We want to expand and improve on features. We have already developed many free and premium features but there is still room for improvement. 
If our campaign succeeds, we can speed up the development and manufacturing process. 


With your contribution you get 


7 USD: Donate and get a coupon to unlock one premium feature from the app. Applicable to Nikon and other brands (when released), so even if you do not have a Nikon camera now, you can use this to get discounted premium features later on. Code to unlock premium feature will be sent by email. 

24 USD: Basic kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera. See chart below for included features. 

54 USD: Pro Kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Pro kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera. See chart below for included features. 

89 USD: Full Kit (includes one Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Full kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B based on your camera.  See chart below for included features. 

Special for Indiegogo

89 USD: Gold Kit (includes one Gold Pinout device) with free app and access code to all Full kit features. Choose from Type A or Type B.  Limited Quantities. Indiegogo Only.






 
 

Plan
We have worked hard to get Pinout to where it is today and we have the technology and manufacturing process set. We hope to successfully finish our campaign by the end of January 2016, finish manufacturing by March, and get Pinout to the contributors in April.
If we get enough support, we will develop devices for other camera manufacturers ASAP, start the manufacturing process in May or June 2016, and ship the first batch out in July 2016. From our R&D experience with developing previous devices in the ZGR series, we have the technology to develop devices compatible with Canon and other manufacturers. We just need your support ☺
We want to hear from you! Please leave a comment with any questions!
 

 
Packaging
We've produced a convenient case to store Pinout when it's not connected to a camera. The case is small enough to fit in a packed camera bag but big enough to not lose it easily. 
 

CONTRIBUTE NOW

A: Previously we developed a precursor to Pinout that is compatible with other camera manufacturers and we'd like Pinout to be compatible with other brands too. However, we do not have the funds currently to start developing and manufacturing Pinout compatible with other brands while keeping all its features. We decided to focus on one brand (Nikon) to put this cool device on the market as soon as possible, and hopefully use the funds we raise to expand compatibility to other brands.

story:
My camera, and its sad story

As many of you will already know, I'm an amateur photographer, and I'm spending the summer in New Haven taking classes. I had gone into New York on June 29th to see a play for my English seminar, and I wound up walking all over town to see a friend's concert at the Bitter End. By the time I got on the train back home to New Haven, I was exhausted, and when I left the train that night, I left without my camera case, which contained my Canon T3i, several lenses, a flash, memory cards, etc. 
That part was absolutely my fault. No two ways about it. 
MetroNorth has a great reputation for returning lost possessions, and I was at the last stop on the last train of the night, so chances were good that I might get my camera bag back. Unfortunately, this didn't happen. My camera was never entered into the lost property system. It was clearly marked with my contact information. Whoever found it chose not to report the item to MetroNorth. Someone needed that camera more than I did, I suppose, and I'm fortunate to have enough in my life that I can absorb the loss of a camera. It isn't my livelihood. 
It is, however, a passion and a hobby that enriched the lives of my friends and the organizations that I've worked with over the last few years.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm fundraising to replace my camera and the accessories I need to keep up my photography. I've set an $800.00 dollar goal which will allow me to purchase a camera body, flash, lenses, and memory cards. With this, I'll be back and better than ever.

For anyone that contributes $25 or more to my campaign, I can offer an hour in front of my camera to anyone who lives in the NYC or New Haven/Yale area. I will shoot whatever you want, whenever I can during the September 2014 to May 2015 school year. I'll even edit them to your liking. I've got experience doing head shots and event photography, but if you've got ideas, let me know! This gives me an opportunity to practice my hobby, and you get photos. For samples of my work, check out my photo page on Facebook, Pichures by Kyle (https://www.facebook.com/pichuresbykyle?ref_type=bookmark ). 

If I fall short of the proposed goal, all funds will still be put toward replacing my camera over a longer timescale. Over the next year, I have the incredible opportunity to travel the world with the Yale Whiffenpoofs. I hope to have replaced my camera by no later than next May, when we leave for our world tour, but I don't want to wait to start taking pictures with this awesome group. 

Yale has been a tremendous gift to me. It's sent me around the world. It's let me sing in Carnegie Hall. It has given me my best friends. As I head into my last year at Yale, I want to be able to take pictures, to preserve in what meager way I can what my alma mater calls "the shortest, gladdest years of life."

Thank you so much for your help, and I hope to see you very soon, though a lens or otherwise.

story:
RIP Canon EOS 40D - On December 22, 2012, Red Works Studio photographer Nadya K. updated her Facebook status with the following announcement:

"After nearly 5 years of steady shooting―7 tours throughout Canada and the U.S., event coverage for many First Nation businesses, groups and organizations, Canadian media, universities and publishers, several annual music/ film festivals and awards shows, youth workshops, and hundreds of photoshoots―it is with deep sadness to inform you all that my camera died this afternoon while shooting a Round Dance in front of Prime Minister Harper's (temporary) residence. Rest in peace, Canon 40D, December 22, 2012. We sure had some good times, met and helped hundreds of people over the years. Please join me. ... ....in a moment of silence.... ... ."

New Gear: Canon EOS 5D Mark III - The funds raised in this campaign go directly towards purchasing the Canon EOS 5D Mark III, which is a much needed upgrade from what I was previously shooting on, and will produce higher quality images, and camera features to support a broader range of shooting opportunities.

  • Canon EOS 5D Mark III (body only)
  • Plus 3 Year Protection Plan

The 3 year protection plan covers manufacturer defects, mechanical malfunctions, is a fully transferable warranty providing worldwide coverage and comes as a highly recommended plan with purchases of this category.

"Kwandibens' photos actively depict the Indian with passion and integrity. She captures an Indigenous spirit (individual and collective) and resuscitates characters overshadowed by the burden of false impression. Her aesthetic, whether shot in black and white or color, is cinematic. Her portraits carry personal and collective strengths forward and create lasting impressions." — Ryan Rice/ Curator
Your Contribution Makes a Positive Impact - A new camera means I can continue to highlight, promote and showcase the diverse cultures of First Nations people, communities, groups and organizations. The images I've photographed over the past 6 yrs have been licensed for use in educational textbooks, university publications, documentaries for CBC, CTV, and other mainstream news. My work also positively affects First Nations youth in communities across Canada through outreach workshops in schools and community centres. By donating you will be contributing to the creation of art and photography that empowers First Nations people across Canada and the United States, which has far-reaching impact on audiences not only in the Americas but also abroad.
Nadya Kwandibens is Ojibwe (Anishinaabe) and French from the Northwest Angle #37 First Nation in Ontario, Canada. She is a self-taught, dynamic photographer specializing in artistic natural light portraiture and event photography.

In 2000 Nadya began exploring photography and while working in video/ radio production, she has gathered the professional experience to easily connect with people and groups. July 2006 marked the start of her portraiture work and since then has travelled extensively photographing people and events throughout Canada and U.S.A. Nadya has worked for numerous groups and organizations including: Canadian Broadcasting Corp., Aboriginal Peoples Television Network, Indspire, imagineNATIVE, Native Earth Performing Arts, Centre for Indigenous Theatre, Kaha:wi Dance Theatre, Big Soul Productions Inc., Manitoba Music, ; as well as several individual artists, actors, musicans and role models.

In October 2008, she founded Red Works Studio and in the same year she began photographing Concrete Indians, a portraiture series and exploration of collective Indigenous identity.

Her photographic work has been featured within the pages of National Geographic Magazine, FACE Magazine, THIS Magazine, SAY Magazine, Red Ink Magazine, and several educational print/online publications for Oxford University Press, McGraw-Hill, and Pearson Canada. Nadya was also the invited artist-in-residence for the Native American Indigenous Cinema & Arts online exhibition, and has exhibited in several group and solo shows throughout Canada and the U.S.A.

Nadya tours twice each year for photo-sessions and to document Concrete Indians portraits, and also delivers empowering photography workshops for Native youth across Canada. She currently resides in Toronto, Ontario.
 
Contribution Perks - Please carefully review the detailed info for each of the perk types offered in this campaign before making contribution(s):
Prints: All are limited edition, signed, numbered, unframed, and shipped flat. Prints 8x12" and 12x18" are printed with Epson 3880 printer with Epson ink on exhibition acid free paper, and the 16x24" prints on Kodak ENDURA professional photo paper with a fine grain pebble texture. You can choose from the following: 
North Bay, ON
January 2007
Thunder Bay, ON
June 2007
Albuquerque, NM
April 2007
Photoshoots: All photoshoots offered through this crowd-funding campaign are discounted rates, must occur either indoor with available light or outdoor with natural light during the 2013 Photoshoot Tour (cities and dates to be announced January 21) and must take place in the closest major city announced. Also note a small additional travel + accommodations fee may apply (which is not included in this crowd-funding campaign). Please check back here and 2013 Photoshoot Tour page for the confirmed list of cities, dates, and additional fee details.
Concrete Indians:
Signed Concrete Indians 16x24" Print
(2 Available)
"Gathering Time"
Toronto, ON
September 2007

Limited Edition Prints - these portraits have never been available to purchase before; though many have asked to own them. Only two portraits are available to own from the two images seen right and below. They will not be offered for purchase, ever again. Each will be signed, numbered, framed, and printed on a wide-format Canon inkjet & laser printer on 70gsm archival paper, and will be carefully packaged/ shipped.

Concrete Indians is a portraiture series of large scale black/white portraits and an exploration of collective and personal Indigenous identity. Since its first inception, the response to this series has been overwhelming; First Nations people from across Turtle Island have been submitting portrait ideas regarding what it means to be urbanized and how living in urban centers either strengthens or weakens (or both) ones own cultural identity. This is an ongoing series which will result in exhibition tours and catalogue of all portraits available to own collectively in photobook format. The exhibit portion of the series will be showcased in galleries, venues and community centres throughout Canada and the United States. For more info, and to see all "Concrete Indians" portraits, please visit: www.redworks.ca

Signed Concrete Indians 24x36" Print
(1 Available)
Tee Lyn Copenace
Toronto, ON
March 2010
 
Other Ways You Can Help - If you cannot contribute, I certainly appreciate any way in which you can help spread the word! You can also connect with me on any of the following networks:

Nadya was also the invited artist-in-residence for the Native American Indigenous Cinema & Arts online exhibition, and has exhibited in several group and solo shows throughout Canada and the U.S.A.
Nadya tours twice each year for photo-sessions and to document Concrete Indians portraits, and also delivers empowering photography workshops for Native youth across Canada. She currently resides in Toronto, Ontario.

 

Contribution Perks - Please carefully review the detailed info for each of the perk types offered in this campaign before making contribution(s):

Prints: All are limited edition, signed, numbered, unframed, and shipped flat. Prints 8x12" and 12x18" are printed with Epson 3880 printer with Epson ink on exhibition acid free paper, and the 16x24" prints on Kodak ENDURA professional photo paper with a fine grain pebble texture. You can choose from the following:  

North Bay, ONJanuary 2007




Thunder Bay, ONJune 2007




Albuquerque, NMApril 2007




Photoshoots: All photoshoots offered through this crowd-funding campaign are discounted rates, must occur either indoor with available light or outdoor with natural light during the 2013 Photoshoot Tour (cities and dates to be announced January 21) and must take place in the closest major city announced. Also note a small additional travel + accommodations fee may apply (which is not included in this crowd-funding campaign). Please check back here and 2013 Photoshoot Tour page for the confirmed list of cities, dates, and additional fee details.

Concrete Indians:

Signed Concrete Indians 16x24" Print(2 Available)
"Gathering Time"Toronto, ONSeptember 2007


Limited Edition Prints - these portraits have never been available to purchase before; though many have asked to own them. Only two portraits are available to own from the two images seen right and below. They will not be offered for purchase, ever again. Each will be signed, numbered, framed, and printed on a wide-format Canon inkjet & laser printer on 70gsm archival paper, and will be carefully packaged/ shipped.
Concrete Indians is a portraiture series of large scale black/white portraits and an exploration of collective and personal Indigenous identity. Since its first inception, the response to this series has been overwhelming; First Nations people from across Turtle Island have been submitting portrait ideas regarding what it means to be urbanized and how living in urban centers either strengthens or weakens (or both) ones own cultural identity. This is an ongoing series which will result in exhibition tours and catalogue of all portraits available to own collectively in photobook format. The exhibit portion of the series will be showcased in galleries, venues and community centres throughout Canada and the United States. For more info, and to see all "Concrete Indians" portraits, please visit: www.redworks.ca

Signed Concrete Indians 24x36" Print(1 Available)

Tee Lyn CopenaceToronto, ONMarch 2010


 

Other Ways You Can Help - If you cannot contribute, I certainly appreciate any way in which you can help spread the word! You can also connect with me on any of the following networks:

story:
UPDATES:


27 May

Hello everyone!
We've been off-line for a while and now we are again here! Our campaign ended a few days ago.

Campaign was not as successful as we would like, mainly because it was perceived rather than a shop, not as an opportunity to support the idea, and of course, because we are unfortunately are not yet able to show the perfect stabilization, as in the competing models that have been developed and improved over the years. However, even the collected funds are enough to continue system development and make new improved prototypes and prepare manufacturing. We have already ordered and received a lot of new parts needed for the development. We are significantly improving SERVOSTAB prototype - equip it with new mechanics, metal housing, a new gyroscope and more accurate magnetic encoder. We'll post news about our new prototype as soon as we get some results. And of course we'll make all possible to send out perks, but time limits may be shifted because campaign goal was not reached.


25 March

We receive a lot of feedback. We will reply to everyone, but that may take a bit of time.

We will also post some updates shortly, stay tuned!

To get latest news about SERVOSTAB project follow us on twitter and Facebook:
http://twitter.com/SERVOSTAB
http://www.facebook.com/servostab

26 March

FAQ section added at the bottom of the page!

31 March

Good news! Now you can get a SERVOSTAB for free! Click here to learn more.

Sample video. We are receiving many requests for an example of stabilized video footage from a camera. So we have made a short video demonstrating the stabilization.

Please notice! We used an early version prototype in this video. Final version we are currently developing has completely different (and better) mechanics. It also will be tuned better and some FW enhancements will be made. We also plan to use better magnetic encoder with higher angular resolution (16 bits instead of current 12 bits, which means 16 times more accurate). Some info about the video:

SERVOSTAB EARLY prototype stabilization test
Camera: Canon 600D (Rebel T3i/Kiss X5)
Lens: Canon EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II
Total weight: 775 grams / 27.3 oz
Focal lengths: 18mm (crop 1.6)
Mount: highly unbalanced one axis mount


08 April

EARLY BIRD 2 perk now avaiable! Get SERVOSTAB for only 109$

14 April

SERVOSTAB goes metal!

Meet metal SERVOSTAB! Now it's fully made of aluminum without any plastic parts, which gives real rigidity to servo motor. Precision CNC machined case allows reaching zero backlash in gear system.

We are now waiting for new PCB's, gyroscopes and encoders with enhanced characteristics to build SERVOSTAB final prototype.

What is SERVOSTAB?

It is a motor designed to stabilize a video camera. The output shaft of the motor remains stationary, while the motor body is moving, thus the direction of the camera attached to the output shaft is not changing. SERVOSTAB stabilizes one rotation axis, however, by using two or three units two or three rotation axes may be stabilized, thereby achieving complete camera stabilization.

SERVOSTAB is made in the format of standard servo motor with size about 4x4x2 cm, which allows the use of existing camera mounts for multi axis stabilization systems and even upgrading already existing systems.

How stabilization works?

SERVOSTAB has built-in gyroscope which detects any rotation. Gyroscope data are being processed by microcontroller and the motor is driven to compensate external rotation. SERVOSTAB works in two different modes. The first mode is full camera stabilization. The second mode is follow stabilization, when only too fast movements and shaking are stabilized while the camera smoothly follows the movements of the operator.

How powerful is SERVOSTAB?

SERVOSTAB is really powerful. It can stabilize most of DSLR cameras and does not require precise camera balancing.

What is required by SERVOSTAB to work?

SERVOSTAB is extremely autonomous and can work without any external devices. Just connect 4.5-8.4V voltage supply and that's all! SERVOSTAB allows direct connection to 7.4V (2S) lithium battery without any converters.

How can I control the direction of the camera?

SERVOSTAB allows control of camera rotation. All rotation control is applied on top of stabilization, as if we control the conventional non-moving servo. SERVOSTAB uses standard servo connector and PWM signal as input. It can be connected to any existing servo controller like RC radio receiver, servo driver, arduino and others. Input signal can be interpreted in several ways selected by user with very flexible configuration, ranging from smooth panning, and ending in a quick and precise positioning.

Are there any limits in rotation?

No. SERVOSTAB allows 360° rotation and unlimited number of turns. Software angle limits can be set by the user to protect the camera and the mount from damages.

How can I configure SERVOSTAB?

Connect SERVOSTAB to your computer using USB and supplied adapter and run our utility. It allows configuration of many parameters and even giving a name to each device so they don't get mixed up in multiple axis mounts. It also allows you to update SERVOSTAB firmware so new features may appear in future.

Any other features?

Lots of them!

For example, the default servo output shaft position is user-settable. You can change it at any time without even touching the motor - no need in unscrewing anything. More to that you can setup servo behavior at power-on, whether it will start stabilizing from current position or it will slowly move to default position. Using camera mounts with gears or belts is also not a problem - just setup scaling factor of gear and select whether the output shaft direction should be reversed.

Unlike other servo motors SERVOSTAB has the full color indication LED on back side. Each color has its meaning, though the LED can be deactivated to prevent unwanted flares.

There are also features that the user won't usually see, but they are still very important, such as overheating protection, camera mount jamming protection, wrong connection protection and others.

We also have a lot of ideas to be implemented, which will become available with firmware updates for all users in future. Among them are RS-232 advanced external control, horizon tracking system (using accelerometer already built-in), the possibility to stabilize the servo motor body itself but not the output shaft and more.

We pay great attention to the ease of use, so you do not have to worry about calibrating the gyroscope, playing with numbers (like tuning PID coefficients), fine balancing, etc. Just plug in SERVOSTAB, select modes you want to use and you are ready to go!



What makes SERVOSTAB the best stabilization solution?

  • Compact size: no external controllers/sensors/wires/etc. Apply power and that's all. One more wire if external control is needed.
  • Huge torque: while having small size SERVOSTAB produces really huge torque for heavy camera stabilization and even capable of driving seriously unbalanced systems: no need for precise balancing.
  • Standard dimensions and connection: fully compatible with existing camera mounts and servo controllers: replace and go!
  • Ease of use: no need in fine tuning.
  • Power efficiency: consumes nearly zero power when not moving (in balanced systems).



How is it made?

To make all features possible some modern technologies were used:

Microcontroller is the brain of SERVOSTAB. We use powerful STM32 microcontroller with ARM Cortex-M4 core running at 72 MHz. All this power is used for complex mathematical algorithms that control position and stabilization about 4000 times per second.
MEMS gyroscope is built-in SERVOSTAB and allows to obtain the angle of rotation. Having dimensions of only 4x4x1 mm it contains complex constantly moving mechanical parts inside. Powerful mathematics is used to process gyroscope data and get precise rotation angle with nearly zero drift over time.
Magnetic encoder is used as output shaft position sensor. Unlike ordinary potentiometers used in regular servos, magnetic encoder is contactless sensor, thus it will never wear out. More to that it allows 360° rotation and even multiple turns. Also magnetic encoder provides really high accuracy of 0.088°.
Coreless motor unlike conventional motor which has a heavy rotor comprises a light rotor which can start, stop and change direction very fast. That is very important for stabilization accuracy and smoothness. Moreover coreless motor has high power that allows stabilizing heavy cameras.
Metal gears and dual ball bearing ensure high reliability and good mechanical characteristics of the servo motor. Large torque allows stabilization of heavy cameras and poorly balanced systems. Near zero backlash increases stabilization smoothness.
Full metal housing provides high durability, reliability and good heat dissipation needed for such powerful device as SERVOSTAB. Although the current prototype is partly plastic, we plan the final version to be fully made of metal.

We started SERVOSTAB project in early 2013. During past year we have tested a lot of concepts, developed several prototypes, solved dozens of technical challenges.

We finally developed all the electronics for SERVOSTAB. It consists of two small PCB's, having sizes of only 35x16mm and 10x15mm.

These two boards are tightly placed inside SERVOSTAB, one above another. Maintaining small size we managed to place all the components on these boards, see how it looks like assembled:

Finally we assembeled it all together:



How will my contribution help?

Making SERVOSTAB real requires following:

  • Final prototyping and testing. We are working on final ready for production prototype, it will be made fully from metal. We also do a lot of testing, and plan even more because we want to be sure that SERVOSTAB will work perfectly in any possible configuration so all our customers will be satisfied.
  • Manufacturing equipment. Most of the parts are ordered on side-factories but we plan to produce some of them by ourselves with our own equipment which gives flexibility, reliability and cost efficiency. Also we are designing equipment for testing each of produced SERVOSTABs to make sure that every single one works perfectly.
  • The first batch. To make the first batch economically possible components for at least 200 devices should be ordered.


When SERVOSTAB will be ready?

We have finished most complicated part of development. It's time for final tuning and testing. We plan the first batch to be manufactured in August and first devices to be shipped in September.

Frequently Asked Question


General

Does the servo function adequately if it is mounted horizontally? Can it stabilize pan/yaw/roll axis?
Yes. Servo orientation does not matter, it will work properly in any orientation due to use of gyroscope, not accelerometer. Though SERVOSTAB also has accelerometer built-in (in fact IMU) and we plan to add horizon tracking system in future FW updates. Of course such system will work only for servo horizontal axis orientation.

Does the servo comes with the PC software and USB adapter?
Yes. USB adapter comes with each SERVOSTAB. You may also use third-party RS232-USB adapters. Software will be freely available for downloading at our website.

Do you need beta-testers?
Probably yes. If you want to become a beta-tester, please send an email with subject "Beta-testing" to support@servostab.com. We will contact you once we will start beta testing.

What's the expected cost once you bring it to market?
We expect the final price to be in 100$-150$ range. It depends on many factors, such as the final prototype materials cost, the success of this campaign, the mass production costs and others.


Technical specs

Does SERVOSTAB supports geared/belt gimbals?
Yes, it does. There is a "scale" field in our setup utility, which scales the output shaft angle by some factor. For example if your gimbal gear/belt reduction has ratio 1:10, you just need to enter 10.000 scale factor and probably select "reverse" option if you use one gear pair. That's all. After that you can setup SERVOSTAB like there is no gear, for example you can set up an angle limits in degrees (or using interactive mode, by turning servo output shaft in released mode).

What is the torque of SERVOSTAB?
Current prototype has torque about 12 kg*cm@7.4V. We expect it to be something around that in mass production version.

What is the frequency of the sensing/adjustment that is taking place?
The gyroscope is sampled at 1000 Hz, the magnetic encoder at 4000 Hz and the motor PWM level is updated at 4000 Hz (each 5th PWM pulse).

Does SERVOSTAB require PID tuning?
Our current tests show high stability with different loads without additional tuning. In the final version we expect either no PID tuning by the user or very simplified tuning like setting one of the presets.


Contributions and perks

What happens to perks if goal is not reached?
We will continue to work on the project in any case, but if the goal is not reached, time frames may be shifted. We appreciate your participation and will do everything to send out perks.

Can I grab one perk more than once?
Yes. To do that you should contribute a few times, each time selecting the perk.



For any questions and suggestions email us: support@servostab.com

story:
ABOUT ME


Hi friends! For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Andrew Kung. I was born and raised in the beautiful city of San Francisco but I recently left home for New York City to further explore my creative passions. During the weekday, I work at LinkedIn as a strategy/ops analyst; outside of work, I love photography, education, mentoring, meditating, and everything related to sports.

I’ve had the privilege of being selected as one of the participants of the Millennial Trains Project, a transcontinental train journey for diverse groups of young innovators to explore America’s frontiers, grow as leaders, and launch projects that benefit and inspire their communities. Now here’s where I need your help; in order to take part in this week long journey, I will have to crowd fund $5,000 in one week. To spice things up, I’ve included a few different gifts based on the amount you choose to donate (only if you wish, no pressure!).


ABOUT MY PROJECT

My project is a photojournalism project that aims to provide a visual lens of our broken education system. Many people are aware of this “hot topic” and read articles on how our public school system is failing but don’t truly understand how students, families, and teachers are impacted by the disconnect between policy makers and urban communities.

My goal is to interview students and teachers at local, struggling K-12 schools during each leg of the journey (Pittsburg, Chicago, Kansas City, Albuquerque, and Los Angeles). These visits will result in a portraiture series for each person I speak with coupled with anecdotal stories that are uncovered over throughout the day. My hope is that these stories give a voice to families and students who often feel victimized in rapidly changing (but well intentioned) reforms that fail to capture the necessary on-the-ground impact for tangible, impactful change.

While I realize I cannot 100% impact the education system in a week long exploratory project, my goal is to start a “Behind the Lens” series in all urban cities across the United States; I plan on using this experience as a spring board to increasing visibility of this issue via visual storytelling. Each series will result in a photojournalism book and web series that can be easily distributed across all social media outlets for maximize exposure. Stay tuned for more updates and thank you in advance all for the support!


ABOUT MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT

THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is an award-winning 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads transcontinental train journeys for young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers. This an officially-approved campaign for one of MTP's August 2016 journeys.

Contributions toward successful applicant campaigns go directly to MTP to help underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities) and are tax-deductible.


Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you can't donate! Feel free to share on your social media platforms or follow along at:

Website/Blog: APKung

Instagram: andrew_kung

Thank you for all of your support!

impact for tangible, impactful change.
While I realize I cannot 100% impact the education system in
a week long exploratory project, my goal is to start a “Behind the Lens” series
in all urban cities across the United States; I plan on using this experience
as a spring board to increasing visibility of this issue via visual
storytelling. Each series will result in a photojournalism book and web series
that can be easily distributed across all social media outlets for maximize
exposure. Stay tuned for more updates and thank you in advance all for the
support!



ABOUT MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is an award-winning 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads transcontinental train journeys for young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers. This an officially-approved campaign for one of MTP's August 2016 journeys.
Contributions toward successful applicant campaigns go directly to MTP to help underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities) and are tax-deductible.

    Other Ways You Can Help No worries if you can't donate! Feel free to share on your social media platforms or follow along at:
Website/Blog: APKung
Instagram: andrew_kung
Thank you for all of your support!

story:
OUR REQUEST

To launch our new, nonprofit 501(c)3 foundation, we seek the generous support of Indiegogo backers for the foundation’s initial, ambitious undertaking:

The Disappearing America Project.

Just as vintage, historic photographs are national treasures, we believe that a sweeping photographic study of old, endangered, and fast-vanishing places, enriched by evocative video stories, will become priceless national resources, preserved for unending generations at America’s oldest federal cultural institution: the nation’s amazing Library of Congress.

Old General Store in Alabama by Carol M. Highsmith

BACKGROUND

For 33 years, renowned American photographer Carol M. Highsmith has crisscrossed the nation, producing a vast visual record of our times. She has donated more than 25,000 images, copyright-free, to the world via our treasured Library of Congress.  There, they stand among the Library’s top six featured collections, alongside the work of Mathew Brady, Dorothea Lange, and others. 

Highsmith is the only living photographer so honored.

Now, Highsmith and distinguished videographer Connie Doebele, a longtime producer of some of C-SPAN’s most important and compelling programs, have founded the This is America! Foundation to support the creation of a definitive visual study of early 21st-Century America.

No such effort has even been attempted since photographers fanned out across the nation to document the ravages of the Great Depression 75 years ago.

And the foundation’s first expedition, for which we enlist the help of Indiegogo backers, will focus on “Disappearing America.”

Route 66 General Store in Hackberry, Arizona by Carol M. Highsmith

WHAT’S “DISAPPEARING AMERICA”?

No doubt you’ve seen the toll of merciless time and changing tastes across our land: Sagging barns.  Abandoned gas stations.  Drive-in movie theaters reduced to junkyards.  Shabby trailer courts and family-owned motels, cluttered general stores, and butcher shops with sawdust on the floor barely hanging on.  Like quirky snake farms and giant dinosaurs and freaky museums, all were once everyday staples of American life.

Fewer and fewer of these vestiges of simpler days are being rescued or restored.  Many old places disappear from the landscape as corporate farming supplants family farms, interstate highways draw traffic away from the old, two-lane roads, and sprawling subdivisions and shopping malls spread into rural dales.

Old Motel Sign in Las Vegas by Carol M. Highsmith

VISUAL PRESERVATION

People snap photographs of these endangered landmarks all the time on cellphones, inexpensive still and video cameras, and occasionally on fine equipment to produce images for exhibit or sale.  Most of these images are here today and forgotten tomorrow.

But Highsmith’s photographs of old places, and Doebele’s stories about men and women who created round barns and teapot-shaped diners and dancing neon signs will survive for untold generations to come, protected, preserved, and made available to everyone, everywhere without copyright restriction at the place we call “America’s Memory.” 

Big Tex (before he burned to a crisp) at the Texas State Fair by Carol M. Highsmith 

Thanks to their incomparable preservation specialists and facilities, Library of Congress curators tell us there’ll be “no end date” to our Disappearing America images and videos that depict a nation in the thrall of change -- even as today’s digital format, like yesterday’s celluloid film, becomes outdated.

Indiegogo funders can help make the historic Disappearing America Project a rousing template for other This is America! Foundation expeditions to follow.  And by underwriting this project, you’ll be supporting the everlasting preservation mission of the Library of Congress: the greatest body of knowledge and creativity on earth.

Mammy's Restaurant in Natchez, Mississippi by Carol M. Highsmith

story:
The agua legend is back with THREE storm-proof bags for cameras and drones!

    Ultra-versatile storm-proof backpack for carrying photo gear / everyday use

    Probably the FASTEST storm-proof sling bag in the world! 

    Carry your Mavic / Spark drone as far as you can, in any challenging weather

    Dear backers, Two years ago, crowdfunding helped us bring the agua storm-proof holster to life. And now, we are super-excited to return to Indiegogo with 3 completely new storm-proof bags for DSLR cameras, Mavic and Spark drones. We took our time to make sure they are the best storm-proof bags you can find for your camera or drone. We hope you feel the same. Enjoy!

    (Hey, there's more below! Scroll down for the Drone Lander and Sling bags... )

     

     

    Smart and stylish for everyday use, tough and capable for ANY outdoor photography adventure.

    The Miggo Versa Backpack as its name suggests, is an ultra-versatile IPX3 storm-proof backpack for carrying professional photographic gear, as well as for daily use. The bag lets users enjoy a handy and carefully designed everyday bag, while the photographic gear is safely stored in a "doc-bag" insert. With the insert firmly in place, the Versa turns into a tough photo bag for any challenging task.

    Contemporary design and smart features makes it a perfect companion for any day.

    Tough yet agile - it will carry and protect your photo gear in any weather.

     

    Ultra-versatile harness system with 3 carrying modes:

    Backpack position

    Sling position

    Converts from a great looking everyday backpack into quick-draw high-performance camera bag.

    Power up!

    Keep your 14.5" laptop and iPad in a designated storm-proof slot.

    2 storm-proof external pockets let you organize your personal stuff, while keeping it safe and dry.

    Ready for travel. Ready for trouble!

    What is IPX3 standard? 

    The official IPX3 standard states: IPX3 Protected against spraying water: water spraying up to 60º from vertical at 10 liters per minute for 5 minutes at a pressure of 80-100kN/m2. To adhere to this standard, we perform strict tests at a special "wet" lab, located at the factory which manufactures our bags. In addition, just to be sure, we put the bags through a series of intensive field tests.

    Materials: • Tarpaulin • Neoprene • Lycra • Polyester

    (Hey, there's more below! Scroll down for the Sling bag... )

    The "any-weather / any-location" storm-proof sling bag for Mavic Pro and Spark drones.

    Introducing the miggo agua IPX3 storm-proof Drone Lander for Mavic and Spark drones, which offers easy carrying and excellent protection from weather and impact. agua Drone Lander lets you carry your Mavic or Spark easily on your back to the most challenging places in the world or just for a weekend trip with the family.  The bag also comes with an integral landing mat, which doubles as a work station. The agua Drone Lander is made from durable tarpaulin with a stunning matt finish that wraps around the padded insert and serves as an additional layer of protection from the elements such as rain, snow, dust or dirt. 

    Tough enough to tackle any challenging weather and easy to carry on your back.

    The integral landing mat keeps your drone clean in any nasty terrain.

    The padded insert. Custom-made protection for your drone and accessories.

    The integral landing / take-off mat. Be ready for any nasty terrain.

    The padded sling strap. Comfortable and secured.

    Keep your small stuff protected and ready for action.

    What is IPX3 standard?

    The official IPX3 standard states: IPX3 Protected against spraying water: water spraying up to 60º from vertical at 10 liters per minute for 5 minutes at a pressure of 80-100kN/m2. To adhere to this standard, we perform strict tests at a special "wet" lab, located at the factory which manufactures our bags. In addition, just to be sure, we put the bags through a series of intensive field tests.

    Modular dividers:

    Fits other small drone models!

    Question: I have a different drone (not Mavic Pro / Spark). Will it fit?

    Answer: If it's small enough, then yes. To verify that - please measure your drone carefully. If it matches the insert inner dimensions (see below) - then you're good to go.

    Materials: • Tarpaulin • Neoprene • Lycra • Polyester

     

    The Sling - Ultra-fast Storm-Proof Bag

    A one-time combination of superior storm protection and camera quick-draw - Agua Sling offers them both, perfectly! The Agua Sling offers a compact design with surprising storage capability. It can carry a full-format DSLR camera such as Canon 5D Mark 4 (or similar), three professional lenses including 70-200 f2.8, and flash. A wide, padded strap allows easy carrying and quick access to the gear through a side opening. agua Sling is made from durable tarpaulin with a matt finish and offers a rigid bottom made with thermo-forming technology for superior impact protection. It also features a water-proof front pocket for personal stuff, an external and convenient charging port for mobile phones and a dedicated laptop pocket. Like all the bags in the agua series, the Sling is IPX3-standard storm-proof.

    THE FASTEST STORM-PROOF SLING BAG IN THE MARKET!

    Sling's wide and padded strap offers comfort and performance!

    Easy access to your gear

    On-the-fly operation

    Power Up!

    All the attachments you need

    Tough enough for any challenge

    What is IPX3 standard?

    The official IPX3 standard states: IPX3 Protected against spraying water: water spraying up to 60º from vertical at 10 liters per minute for 5 minutes at a pressure of 80-100kN/m2. To adhere to this standard, we perform strict tests at a special "wet" lab, located at the factory which manufactures our bags. In addition, just to be sure, we put the bags through a series of intensive field tests.

    Materials: • Tarpaulin • Neoprene • Lycra • Polyester

    We are miggo. We believe in crowdfunding and we are super-excited to join Indiegogo after 3 successful projects on Kickstarter.

    Why do we like crowdfunding platforms, such as Indiegogo, so much? Simply because this is the best, largest and most professional focus group in the world! Your knowledge is invaluable and what's really cool is that people are happy to share their knowledge and experience - to help developers like us bring to market products that might not have been developed using the traditional way.

    These are just some of the reasons we're here for our fourth crowdfunding project.

    Three years ago, we introduced on Kickstarter the miggo "Strap&Wrap" -  the world's first camera strap that morphs into a compact protective carrier. The campaign raised 400% above target and our young company received a huge infusion of energy to continue developing innovative products.  

    Two years ago we were back again with agua holsters - an IPX3 storm-proof quick-draw camera holster - this time we raised 800% of what we asked for, with only 2000 amazing backers. It gave us a lot of confidence and resources to continue.  

    Last year we introduced Pictar – our revolutionary iPhone camera grip that gives to mobile-photography lovers the ability to truly unleash the power of their iPhone camera and take their photography to a completely new level. Pictar is now sold worldwide -thanks to our amazing backers!  

    And now, we are truly excited to join Indiegogo with our new line of agua bags, offering for the first time a game-changing product not only for photographers but also for the emerging and exciting area of drone photography. 

    Please support our project. Thank YOU!

    Team miggo at video shooting day

    Project's Time-Line:

    Risks and challenges.

    We have invested tons of effort in order to make sure we will be able to deliver the agua bags on time but, Murphy is always on the lookout and many unexpected things can happen . 
    The factory we selected has decades of experience in producing highly technical bags and cases and we have made prepared many samples and carefully selected material suppliers and shipping companies. Backup plans are in place and we promise to make our up-most efforts to reduce any delays that might arise to minimum.

    FAQ:

    1. Power bank size.

    Q: What is the maximum size of the power bank that can fit the Versa Backpack / Sling Bag?

    A: 16 x 10 x 3 cm /  6.2 x 3.9 x 1,2 Inch.

story:
Capsule360 is a motion box that combines multiple operating modes in a single unit. It has 3-Axis Motion capability with SLIDE, PAN and TILT moves. Capsule360 also offers Smart Object Tracking, Enhanced Time-Lapse Modes, 360° Product Photography, Star Tracking for Astrophotography, Panorama and much more.

Capsule360 is compatible with all kind of video devices such as smartphones, action cameras, and SLR or Mirrorless Cameras serving advanced video and time lapse motion modes. 


Capsule360 has a  compact and unique design that allows you to create Pan, Tilt and Slide moves easily. On top of that, all 2 axis movements such as Pan-Tilt, Pan-Slide, Tilt-Slide and even 3-axis motion by combining all together is also possible. You can coordinate up to three Capsule360 units right from your smartphone to create multiple axis movements. When several Capsule360 units are working together to create these motions, they do not need any cable connection at all. No more cable clutter!  All units communicate with each other without a cable. 


You can use Capsule360 to take time-lapse photos as well. It offers both standard and advanced time-lapse modes. The advanced modes are Bulb Ramping, Interval Ramping, Long Exposure and HDR (High Dynamic Range) time-lapse modes.  

These modes do not require the existence of the smartphone during the shooting. Once you have the parameters set and start the shooting, you can just use your smartphone for other purposes. Capsule360 benefits from your smartphone in every possible way, but it is also capable of doing many things by itself. 
 


Capsule360 benefits from the capabilities of your smartphone to the fullest. It can track an object with a single touch on your phone. Just start the app and mark the object you want to track on the screen. That’s it!  Capsule360 will take care of the rest. It will rotate the smartphone to the perfect angle to keep the marked object in the view.  


Capsule360 can also recognize your face and follow you the same way. You don't have to stay within a limited area while you are recording. Vloggers will just love this feature. 
 


Imagine you need to take the 360° photos of an item. It is just a hassle to rotate the item precisely to take all those pictures. You need to keep the same angle between each picture to get a smooth transition effect also you should not move the object at all. Capsule360 turns the whole process into a few touches on your smartphone. Just tell Capsule360 how many pictures you want to take. Capsule360 will rotate the turntable accordingly and it will also trigger the camera to capture smooth and quick 360° photos. 


You can control up to three Capsule360 units with the smartphone app. To make things easier, we have added the auto-mode detection feature. If you are using a Capsule360 for the PAN mode, the app will detect this automatically and it will show the PAN settings for your use. 

If you are using multiple Capsule360 units to combine PAN, TILT or SLIDE moves, each unit will be detected to be used in that particular mode. You don't need to do anything to control your setup from the smartphone app. 
 

Astrophotography can be very challenging when you try to take long exposure pictures of stars and planets that are millions of miles away. Even they appear to be standing still in fact, they are not. They are in an endless motion and they change their position all the time. This means you need to move your camera during the shooting to capture a sharp picture. Imagine trying to move a camera manually to track a star. Capsule360 can do that with great precision using the intelligence of the perfectly designed app. Your next nightscape and star photos will be just out of this universe! 


Capsule360 can also be used as a motorized slider together with the Capsule Slider. You can use the Capsule slider as a manual slider as well. It will turn it into a motorized slider with a Capsule360 unit. Capsule360 will slide automatically with a great precision per your settings. You can fully control it over the smartphone.  

Good news is that you can use not just one but two of Capsule360's with Capsule Slider. You can mount another Capsule360 on top of the first one and this will give the PAN capability. As the Capsule 360 on the bottom moves along the slider, the one on the top will do the PAN movement. 

Capsule Dolly is designed to provide you with freedom of linear and curved slide movements on flat surfaces. Attach your Capsule360 to Capsule Dolly and make it motorized to get smooth motion which will give a professional touch to your videos. 


Create your motion and time-lapse setup easily and quickly! Capsule360 can learn motion paths with your manual movement, just demonstrate them, and they can be repeated as many times as desired. You can configure this motion and all its settings from the mobile application via Bluetooth. 


Our user-friendly and cleverly designed mobile application lets you make all setup and configurations easily. You will not be bored with complex user interfaces and your motion setup will only take 10 seconds.


MIOPS is a pioneering manufacturer of creative camera products. Since its inception, the MIOPS team has harnessed new technologies to deliver innovative devices that offer image and filmmakers truly game-changing features and performance. They pride themselves on helping their users to make previously impossible projects, possible. For more information on MIOPS, please visit: https://www.miops.com
/
