story:
Introducing The Langly Field Jacket.

Our bags have made it to all seven continents - giving a safe home to professional photographer’s gear and hardcore travelers alike. Now, we present to you a new mode of utility and complete protection from the elements. This jacket is the ultimate accessory for travelers, photographers or anyone trying to keep their valuable items safe at bay when weather conditions are less than desirable.

Concept & Design

 The inspiration for the Langly Field Jacket comes from one of the most iconic utilitarian designs of all time, the M-65 field jacket. Originally developed by the military to function in any climate, the M-65 keeps cool on hot days, warm on cold nights, and dry during monsoons. The four large pockets secure all your necessities within easy reach, while the jacket’s clean lines lend it a timeless quality that still influences contemporary style. Our jacket features multiple reinforced snap-flap pockets; an adjustable hood and cuffs; a wind and water-resistant shell; and only the finest hardware available. This garment shines in any weather you may encounter in the city — or on the road.

This Jacket is unisex, see chart below for sizes.

 

Starting from scratch, we engineered our own state of the art materials. Our proprietary weather-shield technology keeps moisture and wind outside the shell while still letting your body breathe, wicking away perspiration to keep you warm and dry. In addition, every seam on the jacket is fully tape-sealed, ensuring a completely weatherproof shell.

Mobility and comfort were also top priorities. Our raglan sleeve design offers unrestricted range of motion without bulk or bunching, retaining our ideal silhouette. Downpours will roll right off the adjustable wireframe hood; its pull-cord system lets you simply and accurately adjust the hood shape and size to your liking. In warmer weather, zippered vents under the arms make it easy to let off steam.

 

Tailored pockets cater specifically to personal devices and the modern globetrotter’s need to access them. Pass-through channels covertly route headphone or battery charger cables from the exterior to the interior upper pockets. We’ve also lined the pockets with an RFID-blocking material to keep your passport, credit cards, and travels documents secure. In photo configuration mode, the Langly Field Jacket features a tether system that can be attached inside the front pockets. The system keeps as many as five much-used accessories at hand.

 

Field Jacket Features 

Every single component, every single process has been considered and measured to make everyday life seamless whether you’re exploring beyond the boundaries or on location getting the perfect shot.

Weather-Shield Technology ™

The Details

OPTIONS

 

 

Size Chart

 

Where do you want to go? No rush, you will arrive soon enough, right on time. Forgo the beaten path; pause frequently to look around and savor unfamiliar tastes, sounds, sights, ideas. If, upon arrival at your chosen destination, you find things different than you expected, question your expectations. If you find yourself less than enamored with where you are, keep moving. What’s stopping you?

Whatever you do, wherever you go, take this jacket along. The worse conditions get, the better it will serve you.

If you help us fund our first production batch of the Langly Field Jacket you will be the first to try out the next generation of functional apparel. 

Let’s go somewhere.

story:
I was born in Sacramento, CA.  Raised by my mother and grandparents in Northern California. I grew up loving the outdoors and nature.  I am living the dream as a Park Ranger and want to share my passion of the outdoors.  I use this to teach gun safety when taking my 11 and 8 year old boys hunting.  Watching them practice safety and enjoying hunting was my goal.  Seeing the smile on their faces when we download their KillShots is priceless! Get outdoors and Explore and Discover!

  Find your target, pull the trigger and a KillShot is captured.  By integrating your cell phone to your Rifle, the KillShot is then transfered to all players cellphones showing the KillShot, thus eliminating that player from the battle.  Wear your best camoflauge, blend into your environment and be the last man standing! Pit clan vs. clan, Sniper vs. Sniper, urban or woodland, you create the Battlefield! No more purchasing expensive CO2 cannisters or paintballs.  No more wasting money on plastic airsoft pellets.  Innovative and realistic military weapon designs to come!     

Designed from the ground floor via 3D design drawings and renderings, KillShot is now ready for a proto-type.  Upon successful funding, a prototype will be produced.  We will field test the KillShot to ensure it will be durable and fully satisfying in a battlefield experience.  With our approval of the final KillShot design, permission will be given to the manufacturer to produce the units for the backers.  Remaining funds will produce an 'X' number of KillShot Digital Camera Rifles determined by the total amount funded and final cost per unit.  After completion of these steps, an aggresive marketing campaign will begin with interested companies to put KillShot on the shelves!!

With your pledges, the next form of virtual Warfare Simulation is being born!

$2,000 = Prototype designed and tested by Davison.  $2,000 = X number of KillShots produced by Davison.  https://secure.davison.com/submitidea/?source_id=710&campaign_name=campaign-GoogleMain&gclid=CN-vq_vlrbACFYje4Aod9RUnSQ

***Not Shown*** Blaze orange on the rifle tip per Federal Regulations.  Each KillShot will be produced with one half inch of blaze orange on the rifle tip.  This is required for the safety of the operator.  This will make KillShot identifiable as a non-lethal replica rifle.  KillShot is 100% HARMLESS as it does not shoot any projectiles.

Original Project Idea

 

 
http://ideasupport.net/view/j5z9wm54711qsntx/

story:
UPDATE no. 1  |  FIRST GOAL HIT IN 2 DAYS!
____________________________________

You did it. You took me to $1k in less than 48 hours and that's incredible. I can't thank you enough and won't yet try. Those will be coming.

WE HIT MY INITIAL GOAL WHICH COVERS A NEW (PROBABLY USED) CAMERA,  BUT MY FULL GOAL IS TO RECOVER THE COSTS I HAD IN THE EQUIPMENT WHEN I PURCHASED IT NEW.

STRETCH GOAL: $2300 

$2300 what I need to hit in order to make back the money that was lost in the gear that is gone. It's the total cost of what I spent just a few months ago and what was stolen  a month ago, today. 

I've pitched this as "an Instagram experiment in generosity" so this is where the rubber meets the road. To those of you who have donated: you're amazing and I mean that with my whole heart. To those of you who haven't yet but will, you're helping take this from "Nate can get a camera" to "Nate can get back everything he lost" and I don't know a better definition of generosity than that. 

We're mid-campaign. I'm going to pass out from gratefulness if we take this all the way.

THE STORY IS AS FOLLOWS >>>

I owned a photography studio for 9 years. At the end of 2013, I shut my doors forever to start a new chapter in a new city. I sold almost everything I owned including all of my professional gear, downgraded to a Fuji X-series camera (which I fell in LOVE with) and moved my life to Seattle, Washington.

On July 4th someone stole that camera. 

The one I had just sold my gear for. 

The only one I had left. 

To add insult to injury, this is the second time this has happened. The first time came with a busted car window and about $30k worth of 5Ds and Canon L-glass jacked from my backseat the first few hours into a New York City visit. They also took an iMac and a few other expensive items. My track record with cameras is somewhat of a tragedy and I’m back to the part where I’m basically devastated.

So I want to try something that I wasn’t able to try the last time, I'm asking you (my Instagram friends) to chip in individually to collectively buy me another camera. Of course, since I’m asking Instagram there will be mostly Instagram specific rewards but I would like to include some opportunities to get coffee or maybe go on an adventure. This is a good way for us to meet, not because you bought my time, but because I don’t know a better way to tell someone “thanks” than in person.

Regardless, I'm running this campaign a little different than traditional ones. 

Here’s where my head’s at:

1) I'M ONLY ASKING MY FRIENDS. I am not opening this up to a web-wide beg where I ask you all to share this with your friends and they ask them to share it when theirs. I’m begging only from my friends. There’s something cool about having access to a community of people who appreciate your stuff and, while the circumstances suck, using the platform that introduced you to say “Hey, can I have your help?". Listen, it’s not YOUR fault that my camera was stolen, but you might be someone who is able to contribute to undoing the whole “fault” thing in the first place. That’s really bizarre and really amazing. 

2) I WANT TO MAKE THIS LESS ABOUT THE REWARDS. Honestly, I’m turning to the one group of people who might most care about something as silly as my Instagramming and I’m asking them to help if they feel like they appreciate it enough to do that. I want people to pitch in not because they want a “reward” but because they empathize and because they enjoy the tiny photos and hopefully interesting quotes they see coupled together on their phones from me every other day. I want to be super up front about this from the start: I’m absolutely putting effort into the rewards because I want to give you something for giving me something, but I don’t want to hide the fact that I’m asking you to be generous. The rewards are an incentive, of course, and I'm cool with that, but let’s be real: I’m stuck and I’m asking for your help in getting me un-stuck.

3) I REFUSE TO DRAG THIS THING OUT. I’m making this campaign 10 days long because I cannot be ok with posting for 20, 40 or 60 days in an effort to talk people into buying something for me that they didn’t lose. I’d much rather you decide whether giving is something you feel good about, and if you do...you just go for it. I’m asking for help from whoever can help, as soon as they are able to help and for as much as they can afford to help. I literally want to hit my goal within 48 hours. If I don’t, I’ll have a few more days to post and plead. I'm going as big as I can for one week and then I'm out. Think we can do it?

4) I’M STARTING IT OUT AT $10. Here’s the thing, I know how important money is. It’s the reason I can’t afford to drop another $2,000 on a new camera right now. Money matters in a lot of ways so I've decided that if someone can only afford to spare one dollar, I’d rather they keep it and use it where they need it. I’ve been torn between the whole “Let them give what they can” and “Don’t ask for cash from people who shouldn’t really be giving it” philosophies. After some thinking, I’ve decided to go with "Option B". This has nothing to do with not appreciating a dollar from a friend who is giving me what they're able, and everything to do with opting to ask my friends who are in a better financial space to give more because it's easier for them.

------------------

Again, this is an odd place for me. I feel lucky to have a chance at seeing my camera replaced by people whom I’ve met through a medium that didn’t even exist 5 years ago, and equally embarrassed to be giving them the opportunity to do so. But I finally decided to do it after being encouraged by my real-life friends and when I realized that I would WANT to know if one of my favorite insta-friends had some misfortune and I could help undo that misfortune.

What I had: I had purchased the Fuji X-M1 when it was relatively new. I had that body, a couple mid-range lenses and a 35mm 1.4 which was magic. I also had 3 batteries, a few chargers, a few cards and a bag that I rarely used. It ended up being just over $2k when I bought everything brand new. If you check prices now, you could get that camera for almost half that price, and I’m totally aware of that. However, it still doesn’t change what I lost in terms of investment. What I’d like to do is set a goal of $1k (which will help me tremendously) but shoot for $2k which will mean I effectively lost nothing, and will help me get the most recent version of the camera that I had originally. 

The reality is that if 100 of my friends pitch in $20 bucks, I'm at my highest goal where I effectively didn't lose a dime. You will have helped un-steal the thing that was stolen. It will be like it never happened, and that's incredible.

So this is it. If you've read this far, then at least you care about what's happening in my life. This is the part where you get to decide if you want to help any how much you are able to. It's also the part where I tell you that I'm grateful either way.

Thank you all so, so, so much. I'm both intimidated and excited by this experience. 

Now let's get it.
story_txt: UPDATE no. 1  |  FIRST GOAL HIT IN 2 DAYS!____________________________________You did it. You took me to $1k in less than 48 hours and that's incredible. I can't thank you enough and won't yet try. Those will be coming.WE HIT MY INITIAL GOAL WHICH COVERS A NEW (PROBABLY USED) CAMERA,  BUT MY FULL GOAL IS TO RECOVER THE COSTS I HAD IN THE EQUIPMENT WHEN I PURCHASED IT NEW.STRETCH GOAL: $2300 $2300 what I need to hit in order to make back the money that was lost in the gear that is gone. It's the total cost of what I spent just a few months ago and what was stolen  a month ago, today. I've pitched this as "an Instagram experiment in generosity" so this is where the rubber meets the road. To those of you who have donated: you're amazing and I mean that with my whole heart. To those of you who haven't yet but will, you're helping take this from "Nate can get a camera" to "Nate can get back everything he lost" and I don't know a better definition of generosity than that. We're mid-campaign. I'm going to pass out from gratefulness if we take this all the way.THE STORY IS AS FOLLOWS >>>I owned a photography studio for 9 years. At the end of 2013, I shut my doors forever to start a new chapter in a new city. I sold almost everything I owned including all of my professional gear, downgraded to a Fuji X-series camera (which I fell in LOVE with) and moved my life to Seattle, Washington.On July 4th someone stole that camera. The one I had just sold my gear for. The only one I had left. To add insult to injury, this is the second time this has happened. The first time came with a busted car window and about $30k worth of 5Ds and Canon L-glass jacked from my backseat the first few hours into a New York City visit. They also took an iMac and a few other expensive items. My track record with cameras is somewhat of a tragedy and I’m back to the part where I’m basically devastated.So I want to try something that I wasn’t able to try the last time, I'm asking you (my Instagram friends) to chip in individually to collectively buy me another camera. Of course, since I’m asking Instagram there will be mostly Instagram specific rewards but I would like to include some opportunities to get coffee or maybe go on an adventure. This is a good way for us to meet, not because you bought my time, but because I don’t know a better way to tell someone “thanks” than in person.Regardless, I'm running this campaign a little different than traditional ones. Here’s where my head’s at:1) I'M ONLY ASKING MY FRIENDS. I am not opening this up to a web-wide beg where I ask you all to share this with your friends and they ask them to share it when theirs. story:
Why photography?

Children love cameras. They love having their picture taken & they love snapping the pictures themselves. We want to bring this love & joy to kids who have never held a camera before. Kids who would never have a chance to otherwise. They’ll see themselves & their lives through a different lens. Literally.


Why a photography workshop?

I was walking through Cité Soleil, the largest slum in the Western Hemisphere located in Haiti, one of the poorest places on Earth. Trash littered the streets and dirty stagnant rainwater was often used as latrines. The sun pulsated directly overhead, bleaching the blue sky to a blinding white. Sweat droplets raced down my spine and pooled at my lower back. Children dressed in rags – or for some, in nothing at all – played a spirited game of soccer with a half-inflated ball. I snapped a picture of a group of rambunctious kids, only to have eager young hands grab at my camera to see the image captured on my screen. 

The novelty of the reproduction faded and most darted off between the shanty houses. One remained, diligently pointing at each face on the screen, as if ticking them off in his head. He stopped at the last one. His own. He let out a burst of pure, innocent, giggling glee and scampered off. Alone, I realized that for people who have next to nothing, a mirror was an unattainable luxury. This child only met his reflection by process of elimination. For he knew which ones were his friends and which one was the stranger.

I was struck dumb. For I never realized a person could walk through life without knowing his own physical self. But photography can change that. It lets a child see himself & his world through different eyes. By learning tangible skills & a new avenue of self-expression, he can contribute to his life & his community.


What we’re taking on.

We partnered with Respire Haiti, a school in Gressier, Haiti that educates restaveks (child slaves), to hold a week-long workshop in January 2013. We will be there for the third anniversary of the devastating earthquake that changed the Haitian landscape. Twenty-five students will document their own stories in relation to the commemoration of a national disaster. Some will discover the possibility of being a photographer / a journalist / a storyteller when they grow up. For others, the workshop will be a healing tool to help them discover who they are beyond the forced servitude they are subjected to. We will also host a gallery show at the end of the week showcasing the students’ images. The show will allow the children to show their self-worth to themselves & to their caregiver families. 


What your money will buy.

to take the pictures : 25 cameras, 25 memory cards & AA rechargeable batteries
to edit the pictures : laptop & external hard drive
to print the pictures : printer, paper & ink
GRAND TOTAL = a week-long workshop with 25 kids & a gallery exhibit of their work. WOW.


What you’ll get by donating.

Warm, fuzzy feelings for making a difference with a child you’ve never met.
And your choice of a gorgeous print of one student’s work, a stunning coffee table book of the workshop’s photographs or even a once in a lifetime trip to Haiti to join us. And you know you want join us. How could you not? It’s 7 days of bug spray, sunscreen & kids who are so excited to see you, you’ll feel you’re this weird hybrid of a rock star, Santa Claus & the ice cream truck driver.


Here’s how you can help.

First, GIVE GIVE GIVE. Kinda obvious, but better to be super obvious in an obvious sort of way.
Second but just as important, tell everyone you know to give too. If you’re wondering who we mean by “everyone”, we mean those who need a little boost to get into Heaven, need some good karma, your mother, your frienemies, your boss, rich people, generous people, people with buck teeth, people without buck teeth, your best friend.
Seriously, spread the word!
Call them.
Text them.
Tweet them.
Like us on Facebook.
Go to Vimeo, click the “Like” button, leave a glowing review.
Hint, you can share right from the Facebook / Twitter / Goggle+ buttons below the video. 


Now for the accounting.

View Finder Workshop is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions made to View Finder Workshop are tax-deductible to the fullest extent permitted by law. A tax receipt will be sent to you from Fractured Atlas. Which means your accountant is going to be mighty happy with you. And with us. 


Thank you, thank you, thank you.

Seriously, thank you. Every little bit helps. So let’s go rock these kids’ lives!
Cheers!

story:
THE INTRODUCTION
Since 27 years I live in Graz. I was raised here, went to school here, studied here. Now it’s enough. I love this city but I have to grow, broaden my horizon, see and learn. I need to leave!



ABSTRACT
I want to roam, starting in Amsterdam. Making photographs of things I like: food, crafts, sailing... I would like to inspire other people and document what I will learn. I tought in a workshop for analogue photography to earn some money alongsides my studies. As I will spend the little money I have on traveling I need financial help to buy camera gear. The photographs I shoot I want to provide primarely free: to motivate and inspire. And more should follow (Books, Magazines, etc.)



THE DETAILS

My Project
To ask people to finance a personal camera equipment is quite frankly selfish. Bit  photographs of other people gave me energy when I felt somehow exhausted working or studying during the last years. They let me escape everyday life and let me dream, so I could rest for a moment.
Now I want to deliver such pictures and let other people dream or escape their boundaries for a few minutes, when they look at my photographs on my website, blog or even my photobooks.

The first step: Amsterdam
I am especially interested in food and crafts so I will seek interesting places and people to document their experience and expertise. As an ongoing engineer I like to look for innovative products concerning energy supply and transport. This made me plan to go to Amsterdam in spring 2017, as the first destination on my hopefully worldwide-ish roam. I can imagine Amsterdam nearby big harbors with a lot of food and spices shipped to Europe will satisfy my needs at first. Additionally, I have always considered the bike as the best transport system in a city and in Amsterdam I guess I'm at the right place for that - maybe I will find a job concerning bicycles, traffic and engineering. At last, there is another big issue, that drag me to Amsterdam. The fair-transport project with the old sailing ship "Tres Hombres" has its home port just an hour away from Amsterdam (check it out: http://fairtransport.eu/ships/tres-hombres). A ship that transports regularly high quality organic rum from the Caribbean to Europe just with the power of the wind. I want to see that!

My Background
I started to shoot photographs in high school where we had many of somewhat artistic presentations. Then, for a rather long time, I forgot how much I liked it. I have always needed to work during my studies to pay my bills. During a chemistry workshop I did for children, a colleague and I decided to do an analogue BW photography experiment. I was hooked! Soon had my own analogue photography workshop using my dad's old analogue camera. I watched and read a lot about photography and was able to borrow camera gear from friends to play and learn. Now I want to get more serious with an own camera gear.

The Benefits
I want to deliver the best photographs I am able to shoot documenting the experiences I make during my journey, to give insides in new cultures, portrait the best craftsmen at what they do best, shoot the best food and the most awesome spices, while I'm traveling with a 100-year-old sailing ship. And all this for free: to motivate and inspire.

The Risk
I am a passionate photographer but I am not a professional (at least not by now). There is a slightly chance of my photographs no being that perfect, inspiring or motivating (at least at the beginning). It would be great to give me a chance!

The Gear
I want to make it short. I really would love to own:

A Canon or Nikon. The all-rounder 5D (Canon) or the D810 (nikon) seem really perfect for my needs. The two of the best lenses I can get for my budget: something like a fixed 50 mm and a something to ~ 200 mm including filters to protect them.
Finally a bag to transport them safely.
The rest of the money (if there is some) will be spent on flashcards, filters, extra batteries, a tripod, reflector, and maybe on a new laptop (mine is 8 years old).

You want to help - in another way?
It is a lot what I am asking for. If you can't spend any money, but want to help, I always need contacts to photographers to learn, craftsmen, sailors, chefs for photographing their work, or to people who sell equipment.


THANK YOU!

+ Thanks to all my friends who have already helped my to launch this campaign!

### PERK INFO ###

Perks which include photographs, that are going to be produced, may need some time before you will have them.

story:
High resolution day only cameras have small pixels and sensor sizes, usually 4 to 5 mm. However, good night vision requires a larger sensor and big pixels. Very high resolution with big pixels require a very big sensor and an equally large lens — goodbye portability — and a budget busting price tag of more than 10x Aurora’s current cost.

Aurora is affordable access to action through advanced technology that captures the adventures of your days and your nights, truly.

 Digital Trends  |  Venturebeat  |  Coolthings  |  Theawesomer  |  PCAuthority  |  GeekyGadgets | TURN-ON  |  xbt  |  wwwhatsnew

Light is the key to crisp images. With 3 user-selected modes — Day, Twilight, and Night — SiOnyx Aurora will make the best use of available light. With the correct mode selected, that means seeing deer in the woods at twilight is just as possible as birds in the marsh at high noon.

SiOnyx Aurora has an IP67 Waterproof rating which means it can withstand water up to 3ft deep for 30 minutes. And gracefully handle pool splashes, rain and snow, or a water bottle spill.

 At just under 8 ounces and sized to fit comfortably in one hand for easy operation, the SiOnyx Aurora packs a lot of features into a compact package. A removable neck strap allows you to keep it accessible on any adventure.

Back at camp you’re admiring the sparkling night sky through your SiOnyx Aurora — so many stars! — when you hear a rustling in the bushes. Curious as to what it could be, you set up Aurora in time-lapse mode to record periodically what happens while you sleep.

 Audio recording in Stereo Mode for crisp, clear sound.

SiOnyx Aurora stores imagery on a 32 GB Micro SD card which provides enough storage for 4 hours of video.

Streaming high quality content to social media is as essential as breathing these days. Ok, maybe not. But with SiOnyx Aurora’s WiFi capability and App for iOS or Android you can share your adventures on social media so that friends, family, followers — no one — misses out.

Mr. Saylor’s career spans more than 20 years of emerging technology design, development and commercialization in a range of imaging markets. Prior to joining SiOnyx, he served as a Vice President of Product Management and Product Marketing for Adobe® Systems where he managed Adobe’s award-winning digital video product line. 

Mr. Saylor joined Adobe from FlashPoint® Technology, a digital imaging company he co-founded with a team from Apple®, which they built into one of the most prolific licensing firms to serve the consumer digital photography industry. 

In his early career, Mr. Saylor held a variety of technology management, marketing and engineering roles with Apple, Polaroid® and Technicare™ Corporation. Mr. Saylor holds a B.S.EE from Northeastern University.

Dr. Carey is an expert in optical physics and the interaction of materials with ultra-short laser pulses. Dr. Carey played a key role in the discovery of the unique optoelectronic properties of pulsed laser microstructured silicon, the study of which formed the basis for his Ph.D. in Applied Physics from Harvard® and led to the founding of SiOnyx. Dr. Carey is an author of more than 20 papers and conference proceedings, is a named inventor on 12 U.S. and international patents, and has presented at numerous international conferences. Dr. Carey also holds a B.S.E from the University of Michigan.

Dr. Vineis has a deep background in semiconductor material and device development. Prior to joining SiOnyx, Dr. Vineis was with Wakonda™ Technologies, an early-stage company developing flexible thin-film photovoltaics that was ultimately acquired by Solexant® (now Siva Power). 

From 2005 to 2008, Dr. Vineis served as a Member of the Technical Staff for MIT® Lincoln Laboratory developing InGaAs(P) avalanche photodiode arrays for single-photon time-of-flight (LIDAR) imaging. 

Dr. Vineis started his career with AmberWave™ Systems as Director of Wafer Technology. AmberWave’s strained silicon technology for high speed/low power CMOS was licensed or utilized by a wide range of semiconductor companies including Intel®, TSMC, UMC®, Applied Materials®, LG® Siltron and SUMCO™. Dr. Vineis holds a Ph.D. from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and a B.S.E. from the University of Pennsylvania in Materials Science and Engineering.

In his role as VP of Business Development for SiOnyx, Dr. Pralle is helping to deliver next-generation silicon-based optoelectronic technologies to military and other government applications. 

 Prior to joining the Company, Dr. Pralle served as General Manager of the ICx Technologies™ Photonics business unit. As VP of Engineering at ICx Technologies, he developed photonic crystal MEMS infrared emitter and sensor technology that was deployed to solve critical combat identification needs in the thermal imaging bands. Dr. Pralle holds a PhD from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and a B.S. from Cornell University in Materials Science and Engineering.

Dan Cui is the acting Chief Marketing Officer for the new SiOnyx Aurora ULTRA Low-Light, consumer video camera and comes to the company with deep, 30-year expertise in semiconductors and AR as well as consumer products launched on a global scale. 

Dan was previously Chief Marketing Officer for eMagin’s HMD (head-mounted display) Division. He also was a pioneer in the AR Smart Glasses market during his time at Myvu/ViewLink (one of the early HMD market leaders and developers of the first Android-based smart glasses). Myvu’s patents eventually enabled the development of Google Glass. 

Prior to joining eMagin, he held the position of Vice President of Sales at Vuzix, where he conceived and implemented Vuzix’s AR strategy into the enterprise sector, creating solid relationships with companies such as DHL, SAP, and Lenovo. His efforts successfully raised Vuzix’s market visibility in advance of Intel’s $24.8M investment in Vuzix and subsequent uplift to NASDAQ. 

Dan was also a key principal at Aura Semiconductor, one of the first near field communications (NFC) silicon providers. Dan is an Air Force veteran who enjoys Ham Radio, Piloting, Scuba Diving and is an acclaimed breeder of Shiloh Shepherd dogs.

High resolution day only cameras have small pixels and sensor sizes, usually 4 to 5 mm. However, good night vision requires a larger sensor and big pixels. Very high resolution with big pixels require a very big sensor and an equally large lens — goodbye portability — and a budget busting price tag of more than 10x Aurora’s current cost.Aurora is affordable access to action through advanced technology that captures the adventures of your days and your nights, truly. Digital Trends  |  Venturebeat  |  Coolthings  |  Theawesomer  |  PCAuthority  |  GeekyGadgets | TURN-ON  |  xbt  |  wwwhatsnewLight is the key to crisp images. With 3 user-selected modes — Day, Twilight, and Night — SiOnyx Aurora will make the best use of available light. With the correct mode selected, that means seeing deer in the woods at twilight is just as possible as birds in the marsh at high noon.SiOnyx Aurora has an IP67 Waterproof rating which means it can withstand water up to 3ft deep for 30 minutes. And gracefully handle pool splashes, rain and snow, or a water bottle spill. At just under 8 ounces and sized to fit comfortably in one hand for easy operation, the SiOnyx Aurora packs a lot of features into a compact package. A removable neck strap allows you to keep it accessible on any adventure.Back at camp you’re admiring the sparkling night sky through your SiOnyx Aurora — so many stars! — when you hear a rustling in the bushes. Curious as to what it could be, you set up Aurora in time-lapse mode to record periodically what happens while you sleep. Audio recording in Stereo Mode for crisp, clear sound.SiOnyx Aurora stores imagery on a 32 GB Micro SD card which provides enough storage for 4 hours of video.Streaming high quality content to social media is as essential as breathing these days. Ok, maybe not. But with SiOnyx Aurora’s WiFi capability and App for iOS or Android you can share your adventures on social media so that friends, family, followers — no one — misses out.

As VP of Engineering at ICx Technologies, he developed photonic crystal MEMS infrared emitter and sensor technology that was deployed to solve critical combat identification needs in the thermal imaging bands. Dr. Pralle holds a PhD from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and a B.S. from Cornell University in Materials Science and Engineering.Dan Cui is the acting Chief Marketing Officer for the new SiOnyx Aurora ULTRA Low-Light, consumer video camera and comes to the company with deep, 30-year expertise in semiconductors and AR as well as consumer products launched on a global scale. Dan was previously Chief Marketing Officer for eMagin’s HMD (head-mounted display) Division. story:
I want a new lens for my camera. This isn't a need, I have a lens and it's acceptable. This is me wanting something and begging you to help me get it. You could spend your money in much better way, on charity or people who need it. I couldn't blame you.

I've been taking pictures for free for years. I completely intend to continue doing that whether I get this lens or not. I love taking pictures at baseball games and comedy shows, and wrestling matches, and other fun, live events. I'm hoping that if I've ever taken a picture of you, you'll be willing to help me get a much better lens so that I can take even better pictures of you.

I've saved some money and I'm going to buy a Canon Rebel T5i camera, which will be a massive upgrade over my current Rebel T2i. I want to get a 70-200mm f2.8 telephoto lens to pair with it. It's like the telephoto lens I have now, with one huge difference, the fixed aperture at f2.8. In simple terms, taking pictures is all about how much light gets into the camera, and f2.8 would allow basically twice as much light as I can get with the lens I have, which is f4-5.6, but usually stays fixed at f5.6 because of me zooming to get a better picture.

With this new lens I would be able to get twice as much light into the lens, which will make for better pictures. They won't be as grainy and fuzzy looking because I won't have to max out the ISO to make things visible. Shots at night will be immensely better and I'll actually be able to capture action. Indoor shots, like at comedy shows, will look great because I'll actually be able to get light into the lens and capture action simultaneously. Essentially, with the combination of the new camera I'm buying and the new lens you're donating toward, every picture I take will be twice as good as what I was capable of taking before. 

If everyone I've ever taken a picture of donated just $5 I'd be able to buy two of these lenses. I love taking pictures, I love it when you guys use a picture I've taken as a profile picture, or when people use one of my pictures for their business or promotional material, or when people tell me they have a picture I've taken framed in their house. I will continue taking pictures and posting them on Facebook for free either way. Photography has never been a business for me, I've never made money from it and I don't intend to. I'm hoping you'll help me to get this lens so that I can take even better pictures for everyone.

story:
KYLIN M:

Rebranding the Concept of Filming

The Kylin M is the world’s first revolutionary gimbal stabilizer with a rotatable handle designed to provide ease and better filming output. Its flexible design improves filming accuracy and makes filming more convenient than using traditional gimbals.

 

wedding film demo

A short film shot with Sony 6300 and Kylin M, filmed by Karim in France. Thanks for sharing.

 

Original clips demo

To show the raw clips filmed with Kylin M gimbal and some cameras (Sony, Fujifilm, iPhone7 plus) without any special editing like speed adjustment, software stabilization, color correction etc. The original sound in the clips are also kept on purpose. 

 

Why is Kylin M Unique?

Physical design (visible items)：

  • The world’s first rotatable handle design, enables you to carry it with ease in addition to the standard fishing rod carry position. Carry mode makes it much easier to film at different angles especially for low angle shoot.
  • With Snoppa’s special control cable (option), you can directly control the photo shutter/focus, video record, and zoom for popular cameras (Sony and Panasonic for the time being) making filming more convenient.
  • Roll track mode is supported, in addition to pan track, omni track and lock modes.
  • Light and portable. Compared with other big gimbals, the Kylin M has a lighter body and is primarily designed for lightweight cameras. Paired with the unique carry mode, a videographer has more flexibility and filming freedom.

System design (non visible items):

  • The Kylin M has a parallel bus (instead of a serial port that most other gimbals have), which has excellent extension capabilities. We’ve preserved a bus interface port on the handle (the hole above the zoom button) through which the Kylin M can already equip many accessories and support for many more in the near future.
  • Using our own independently developed algorithms, specially developed over four years, has great controllable stability, excellent adaptability, and more extendable abilities.
     

Compatible with various lightweight filming devices

The Kylin M is primarily created for lightweight cameras and is compatible with lightweight DSLR, mirrorless DC, mobile phones and action cameras. It comes with a special control cable which lets users control shutter/focus, video recording and zoom conveniently.

 

Two Transformable Handling Modes

Unlike other gimbal stabilizers which allow for straight holding only, Kylin M comes with 2 handling modes; the straight holding mode (which is suitable for high angle and medium angle filming) and the carry mode (which is best for low angle filming). Users can film easily at various angles because of its unique design. 

 

 


 

Demo film of carry mode shooting at low angles

 

Also mobile phone compatible

Kylin M is the ideal stabilizer for mobile phone filming enthusiasts who like to use their mobile phones with other heavy camera accessories for high-quality filming output. It provides the balance between small scale handheld phone stabilizers (which does not allow inclusion of external camera accessories) and big scale stabilizers (which allow for inclusion of accessories but are too big for carrying convenience)

In the above picture, the iPhone7 plus mounted on Kylin M is equipped with Zeiss Exo wide-angle lens, and Shure MV88 microphone. In addition, you can also add a light on it if necessary.

 
Test with Kylin M and iphone7
 

 

All Controls Integrated in the Handle Panel 

With our specially designed connecting cable, you have direct shooting control for some popular cameras with buttons right on the handle, including focus/photo shutter, video record and zoom. 

Currently supported camera control: Panasonic Lumix GH4/GH5, Sony mirrorless DC.

 
 

1/4 inch screw extendable

The bottom of the Kylin M’s handle has a ¼ inch threaded hole for users to connect a tripod. This allows you to sit the camera on a spot and helps to extend other ways of filming controls.

 

 

Following Modes

Filmmakers can shoot via various different modes.

Pan track mode
Roll and tilt axes are locked, pan left and right following the arm movement, pushing the joystick up and down to tilt.

Lock mode
Pan, roll and tilt axes are all locked, pushing the joystick to pan or tilt.

Omni track mode
Roll axis is locked, pan and tilt following the arm movement.

Roll track mode
Pan and tilt axes are locked,  gimbal can be rolled by pushing the joystick left and right, or by rolling your arm. 

 

 

Strength and Durability in a Lightweight Body

The extremely light-weight Kylin M comes in at just 980g/2.16 lb (including the batteries) while its payload capacity reaches up to 1300g/2.87 lb, compatible with almost all mirrorless digital cameras on the market, as well as mobile phones, action cameras and even some models of DSLR cameras. 

Notice: 1300g(2.87 lb) is just a rough estimation. The payload depends not only on the weight of the whole filming device (camera + lens), but also the position of its center of gravity. 

If the weight is over 1300g but the center of gravity is close to the gimbal, it may also work.

 

 

Unique Foldable Handle Design

For Portability

The Kylin M’s unique rotatable and foldable handle design allows it to be folded into carry mode.

When the Kylin M is folded into carry mode, the dimensions are only 22 wide and 25cm long, and it can easily fit in a bag for transport.

 

High Decoupling System

With our brand new attitude resolving algorithm, each controlling axis is separated from each other, in order to avoid mutual interference.

 

Extendable Bus Interface

Thanks to the application of a local network controller, we’ve separately preserved a bus interface on the gimbal plate and handle, through which we can attach accessories adding more options and convenience.

Example of BUS interface application 

 

 

Camera Control Cable

(optional accessory)

With the Kylin M’s built-in bus system and our specially designed control cable accessory, we can realize the camera control through the handle buttons, realizing functions of photo focus/shutter, video record and zoom.

 
 
 

Dual Power Source that Keeps Your Camera Charged and Running

Kylin M is equipped with 2 Li-ion batteries 26500 (3200mAh), which can support at least 12 hours of runtime. With the control cable connected, when the gimbal is powered on, it can directly charge your camera to prevent a dead battery from interrupting/ruining your shoot. 
 
 
 

Specifications

 

 

 

The Kylin Pro is equipped with dual handles as well as a detachable central handle, giving you more options while filming or even during downtime between shoots.

There’s a lock ring on the left and right arm, through which you can adjust the handle to any angle you want and then lock it.

 

 

Thåe three handles can work as a tripod that allow the Kylin Pro to stand on the ground, without the need of an extra tripod.

 

 

Rotatable Handle

There’s a lock ring on the left and right arm, through which you can adjust the handle to any angle you want and then lock it.

 

 

1. Camera parameters

2. focus control

3. control wheel for camera parameters

The Kylin Pro integrates a 1.8 inch OLED color screen on its right handle, through which you can read the camera parameters in realtime, including ISO, aperture, and shutter speed.

With the control wheel on the side of the left handle, you can adjust the camera parameters directly, without the need of manually adjusting settings on the camera itself.

Focus can be adjusted by the slider. By pushing the focus button up and down you can easily control the focus position.

1.  HDMI port

2.  CAN bus port

3.  3.5mm Mic

The Kylin Pro has a video output interface built-in allowing you to directly connect your camera and monitor through theintegrated HDMI ports. This prevents cable clutter from affecting the stability of your video, giving you an all around better viewing and recording experience.

The CAN expansion bus can easily connect with our focus controller (soon to be released), an external fill light, remote control and other accessories.

There is also an integrated 3.5mm external microphone jack, allowing you to attach a variety of microphones to the stabilizer. Attaching a high-quality microphone through the stabilizer will allow you to get better audio than the camera’s built-in microphone.

 

Extension Holes for External Devices

There are three 3/8 inch threaded holes and four 1/4 inch threaded holes on the horizontal arm, which are reserved for mounting accessories like external monitor, single handle, microphone support, light support, extension pole and so on.

 

Collapsible arms(Quick spring lock)

 

 

 

 

The left and right arms of the Kylin Pro are collapsible. With the quick release spring locks on the joint of each arm, you can easily fold and unfold the arms quickly, without any troublesome mounting or un-mounting steps.

 

 

Fixing the Mounting Position

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.

 

 

portability

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.

 

 

 

Fixing the Mounting Position

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.

 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
    
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 

Manufacturing

Already in production stage

 

FAQ

1) How long is the warranty?    

The Kylin M comes with a 12 month limited warranty for Indiegogo backers. We also ensure that every unit is free from manufacturing defects and handled with the utmost care during shipment.


2) Which filming devices are compatible with Kylin M?    

Kylin M is primarily designed for light weight filming devices. The actual payload is related not only to the weight of device itself (camera+lens), but also to the position of the center of gravity. If the total weight of filming device is beyond 1300g while the center of gravity is close to the gimbal, it may also work.


3) Why not to make the Kylin M compatible with heavier cams?

Technically it would be easy for us to make the Kylin M with heavier weights (for example, by enlarging the motors and arms), but we would have to sacrifice the portability and make the gimbal heavier. This is not necessary for users of more lightweight cams and would make the whole experience unconformable.

We have to find a balance between weight/portability and payload.  The higher the payload, the heavier the gimbal will be.

In Snoppa’s stabilizer series, Kylin M is designed for lightweight filming devices, with the ability of bearing more weight than ordinary small-scale handheld gimbals for action cameras or phones (in some cases people may add heavier accessories like wide-angle lenses, lights and microphones etc to the phone)  while it is not as heavy as large-scale gimbals for big DSLRs or pro cams. In this case users can have a much better experience filming with lightweight cameras.

For those who need to film with heavier cameras, we are working on another Kylin model (tentatively named the Kylin Pro) which is also very uniquely designed and more powerful to bear more weight, but the body is much heavier than current model M. We will release this new model later once it is in production stage.

4) Will there be control cable support for other cameras?

Currently we only support Sony and Panasonic for the time being. For users of other camera brands please send us your camera model, then we will make a statistics on the demand of other camera models and to decide from which brand/model we should continue to develop.


5) How long does it take to get a full battery charge?    

The battery in Kylin M requires 3 hours from full discharge to full charge with our supplied charger.  


6) Is Kylin M waterproof? 

No, it’s just splash proof.
 

7) Is there a dual-hand handle accessory?

Yes, we have planned to design and produce a dual-hand handle, and will be available world-wide soon. If you wanna hold your Kylin M with two hands to relieve the pressure on your single arm, you can choose this optional accessory soon.
 

8) When I can receive my order? 

We’ve already prepared several hundred sets of materials in stock and have assembled nearly a hundred completed units, some of which we had already sent out to some KOLs and friends of filming pros for review. The first production run was interrupted for two weeks by Chinese lunar new year holidays in February, and we will continue the production at the bottom of February and start to place orders for more materials in early March for the increased demand.

The shipment of the first batch of Kylin M will begin from the bottom of March 2018 after the crowdfunding ends. Actual ship dates will vary depending on your country, your location, and when you’ve placed your order. We will keep you up to date on every step of the process. 

In order to deliver Kylin M safely and efficiently, the orders will be dispatched by different courier companies, depending on the destination regions. Consequently we may ship out in a slightly different order from the initial buying sequence.
 

9) Why order now?    

For promotion purpose we launched this crowdfunding campaign at a remarkable discount in return for all your support.
 

10) Why is the shipping seems high?

A: We spent a lot of time deciding on the right shipping partner and cost. We are afraid to choose a shipping company that is cheaper as we would be left with the bill if the product is damaged or lost, and we don’t want you the customer to receive damaged goods or even lose it.
 

11) Change of address?    

If you need to update your address, please contact our support team: indiegogo@snoppa.com
 

12) Indiegogo’s shipping location lists me in the wrong country?

At the end of the campaign, we will send out a survey confirming where you would like your Kylin M to be shipped.
 

13) What is your refund policy?    

Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis. At some point we will need to lock down refunds in order to go into production and ship product to you. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped.
 

14) Do I have to pay VAT / GST?    

Customers are responsible for assuring the product can be lawfully imported to the destination country. The recipient is the importer of record and must comply with all laws and regulations of the destination country. Orders shipped may be subject to import taxes, customs duties and fees levied by the destination country. The recipient of an international shipment may be subject to such import taxes, customs duties and fees, which are levied once a shipment reaches the recipient's country. Additional charges for customs clearance must be fulfilled by the recipient. Snoppa has no control over these charges.

Kylin M is the ideal stabilizer for mobile phone filming enthusiasts who like to use their mobile phones with other heavy camera accessories for high-quality filming output. It provides the balance between small scale handheld phone stabilizers (which does not allow inclusion of external camera accessories) and big scale stabilizers (which allow for inclusion of accessories but are too big for carrying convenience)
In the above picture, the iPhone7 plus mounted on Kylin M is equipped with Zeiss Exo wide-angle lens, and Shure MV88 microphone. In addition, you can also add a light on it if necessary.

 
Test with Kylin M and iphone7


 
 
All Controls Integrated in the Handle Panel 



With our specially designed connecting cable, you have direct shooting control for some popular cameras with buttons right on the handle, including focus/photo shutter, video record and zoom. 
Currently supported camera control: Panasonic Lumix GH4/GH5, Sony mirrorless DC.

 
 

1/4 inch screw extendable


The bottom of the Kylin M’s handle has a ¼ inch threaded hole for users to connect a tripod. This allows you to sit the camera on a spot and helps to extend other ways of filming controls.
 



 
Following Modes


Filmmakers can shoot via various different modes.
Pan track modeRoll and tilt axes are locked, pan left and right following the arm movement, pushing the joystick up and down to tilt.
Lock modePan, roll and tilt axes are all locked, pushing the joystick to pan or tilt.
Omni track modeRoll axis is locked, pan and tilt following the arm movement.
Roll track modePan and tilt axes are locked,  gimbal can be rolled by pushing the joystick left and right, or by rolling your arm. 


 

 
Strength and Durability in a Lightweight Body


The extremely light-weight Kylin M comes in at just 980g/2.16 lb (including the batteries) while its payload capacity reaches up to 1300g/2.87 lb, compatible with almost all mirrorless digital cameras on the market, as well as mobile phones, action cameras and even some models of DSLR cameras. 

Notice: 1300g(2.87 lb) is just a rough estimation. The payload depends not only on the weight of the whole filming device (camera + lens), but also the position of its center of gravity. 
If the weight is over 1300g but the center of gravity is close to the gimbal, it may also work.
 
 
Unique Foldable Handle Design
For Portability
The Kylin M’s unique rotatable and foldable handle design allows it to be folded into carry mode.
When the Kylin M is folded into carry mode, the dimensions are only 22 wide and 25cm long, and it can easily fit in a bag for transport.




 High Decoupling SystemWith our brand new attitude resolving algorithm, each controlling axis is separated from each other, in order to avoid mutual interference. Extendable Bus InterfaceThanks to the application of a local network controller, we’ve separately preserved a bus interface on the gimbal plate and handle, through which we can attach accessories adding more options and convenience.Example of BUS interface application   Camera Control Cable(optional accessory)With the Kylin M’s built-in bus system and our specially designed control cable accessory, we can realize the camera control through the handle buttons, realizing functions of photo focus/shutter, video record and zoom.


 
 
 
Dual Power Source that Keeps Your Camera Charged and Running

Kylin M is equipped with 2 Li-ion batteries 26500 (3200mAh), which can support at least 12 hours of runtime. With the control cable connected, when the gimbal is powered on, it can directly charge your camera to prevent a dead battery from interrupting/ruining your shoot. 
 
 
 
Specifications   
The Kylin Pro is equipped with dual handles as well as a detachable central handle, giving you more options while filming or even during downtime between shoots.
There’s a lock ring on the left and right arm, through which you can adjust the handle to any angle you want and then lock it.
 

 


Thåe three handles can work as a tripod that allow the Kylin Pro to stand on the ground, without the need of an extra tripod.

 




 
Rotatable Handle

There’s a lock ring on the left and right arm, through which you can adjust the handle to any angle you want and then lock it.
 
 




1. Camera parameters
2. focus control
3. control wheel for camera parameters
The Kylin Pro integrates a 1.8 inch OLED color screen on its right handle, through which you can read the camera parameters in realtime, including ISO, aperture, and shutter speed.
With the control wheel on the side of the left handle, you can adjust the camera parameters directly, without the need of manually adjusting settings on the camera itself.
Focus can be adjusted by the slider. By pushing the focus button up and down you can easily control the focus position.






1.  HDMI port
2.  CAN bus port
3.  3.5mm Mic
The Kylin Pro has a video output interface built-in allowing you to directly connect your camera and monitor through theintegrated HDMI ports. This prevents cable clutter from affecting the stability of your video, giving you an all around better viewing and recording experience.
The CAN expansion bus can easily connect with our focus controller (soon to be released), an external fill light, remote control and other accessories.
There is also an integrated 3.5mm external microphone jack, allowing you to attach a variety of microphones to the stabilizer. Attaching a high-quality microphone through the stabilizer will allow you to get better audio than the camera’s built-in microphone.





 
Extension Holes for External Devices

There are three 3/8 inch threaded holes and four 1/4 inch threaded holes on the horizontal arm, which are reserved for mounting accessories like external monitor, single handle, microphone support, light support, extension pole and so on.







 
Collapsible arms(Quick spring lock)
 
 
 
 

The left and right arms of the Kylin Pro are collapsible. With the quick release spring locks on the joint of each arm, you can easily fold and unfold the arms quickly, without any troublesome mounting or un-mounting steps.
 





 
Fixing the Mounting Position

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.




 





 
portability

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.
 



 




 
Fixing the Mounting Position

Normally you have to rebalance the gimbal after removing the quick release plate to maintain proper stabilization. But on the Kylin Pro, we added a guide to the bottom of the gimbal plate, which allows you to quickly reattach the plate in the proper position.
 




 


             
                           
 
Manufacturing
Already in production stage

 

FAQ
1) How long is the warranty?    
The Kylin M comes with a 12 month limited warranty for Indiegogo backers. We also ensure that every unit is free from manufacturing defects and handled with the utmost care during shipment.
2) Which filming devices are compatible with Kylin M?    
Kylin M is primarily designed for light weight filming devices. The actual payload is related not only to the weight of device itself (camera+lens), but also to the position of the center of gravity. If the total weight of filming device is beyond 1300g while the center of gravity is close to the gimbal, it may also work.
3) Why not to make the Kylin M compatible with heavier cams?
Technically it would be easy for us to make the Kylin M with heavier weights (for example, by enlarging the motors and arms), but we would have to sacrifice the portability and make the gimbal heavier. This is not necessary for users of more lightweight cams and would make the whole experience unconformable.
We have to find a balance between weight/portability and payload.  The higher the payload, the heavier the gimbal will be.
In Snoppa’s stabilizer series, Kylin M is designed for lightweight filming devices, with the ability of bearing more weight than ordinary small-scale handheld gimbals for action cameras or phones (in some cases people may add heavier accessories like wide-angle lenses, lights and microphones etc to the phone)  while it is not as heavy as large-scale gimbals for big DSLRs or pro cams. In this case users can have a much better experience filming with lightweight cameras.
For those who need to film with heavier cameras, we are working on another Kylin model (tentatively named the Kylin Pro) which is also very uniquely designed and more powerful to bear more weight, but the body is much heavier than current model M. We will release this new model later once it is in production stage.
4) Will there be control cable support for other cameras?
Currently we only support Sony and Panasonic for the time being. For users of other camera brands please send us your camera model, then we will make a statistics on the demand of other camera models and to decide from which brand/model we should continue to develop.
5) How long does it take to get a full battery charge?    
The battery in Kylin M requires 3 hours from full discharge to full charge with our supplied charger.  
6) Is Kylin M waterproof? 
No, it’s just splash proof. 
7) Is there a dual-hand handle accessory?
Yes, we have planned to design and produce a dual-hand handle, and will be available world-wide soon. If you wanna hold your Kylin M with two hands to relieve the pressure on your single arm, you can choose this optional accessory soon. 
8) When I can receive my order? 
We’ve already prepared several hundred sets of materials in stock and have assembled nearly a hundred completed units, some of which we had already sent out to some KOLs and friends of filming pros for review. The first production run was interrupted for two weeks by Chinese lunar new year holidays in February, and we will continue the production at the bottom of February and start to place orders for more materials in early March for the increased demand.
The shipment of the first batch of Kylin M will begin from the bottom of March 2018 after the crowdfunding ends. Actual ship dates will vary depending on your country, your location, and when you’ve placed your order. We will keep you up to date on every step of the process. 
In order to deliver Kylin M safely and efficiently, the orders will be dispatched by different courier companies, depending on the destination regions. Consequently we may ship out in a slightly different order from the initial buying sequence. 
9) Why order now?    
For promotion purpose we launched this crowdfunding campaign at a remarkable discount in return for all your support. 
10) Why is the shipping seems high?
A: We spent a lot of time deciding on the right shipping partner and cost. We are afraid to choose a shipping company that is cheaper as we would be left with the bill if the product is damaged or lost, and we don’t want you the customer to receive damaged goods or even lose it. 
11) Change of address?    
If you need to update your address, please contact our support team: indiegogo@snoppa.com 
12) Indiegogo’s shipping location lists me in the wrong country?
At the end of the campaign, we will send out a survey confirming where you would like your Kylin M to be shipped. 
13) What is your refund policy?    
Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis. At some point we will need to lock down refunds in order to go into production and ship product to you. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped. 
14) Do I have to pay VAT / GST?    
Customers are responsible for assuring the product can be lawfully imported to the destination country. The recipient is the importer of record and must comply with all laws and regulations of the destination country. Orders shipped may be subject to import taxes, customs duties and fees levied by the destination country. The recipient of an international shipment may be subject to such import taxes, customs duties and fees, which are levied once a shipment reaches the recipient's country. Additional charges for customs clearance must be fulfilled by the recipient. Snoppa has no control over these charges.

story:
** shipping of £12 will be added to the first two perks. This will be collected when we send out the survey through a system called Backerkit.

At Blind Spot Gear we're on a mission to make the most portable, flexible and innovative power and lighting solutions for the creative industries. This is Blind Spot's 5th Kickstarter, what a journey it's been!

Check out this REVIEW

 

 

And this REVIEW.........

 

 

When will it all ship?

We expect all rewards to leave our warehouses during December 2018. We are confident we can meet this target - as they say, this is not our first rodeo, in fact, it's our 5th. We have great relationships with all our suppliers, our supply chain is in place and our logistics/warehousing partners are tried and tested.

Blind Spot Gear was launched in 2014 comprising of a close-knit team of creatives based in Glasgow, Scotland. The film and powering industry has long been dominated by a handful of companies and a raft of cheap, low-quality power and lighting, making the landscape difficult for smaller professional brands like Blind Spot to thrive in. It is a fiercely competitive market, both online and offline. Whilst the story of Blind Spot so far has been a success; the reality is that we still face the daily challenge of being up against the giants.

Launching a pre-order campaign on Kickstarter allows us to bring the Power Junkie to life.

We’re passionate about the product experience we’ve got to offer and we can’t wait to share it with you all. With your support, we can make our new product a reality.

Blind Spot is now comprised of 7 members that have worked incredibly hard to bring this Kickstarter campaign to life. We really do hope that you like it and whether you’re a new backer of Blind Spot or have been with us since the beginning, we’re hugely grateful for your support.

story:
DO YOU LOVE CARAVAGGIO?

On 18 July 1610 Baroque Style painter Michelangelo Merisi, better known as Caravaggio, died in the little village of Porto Ercole in the South of Tuscany after a tumultuous life. 400 years later in the summer 2010 a team of 3 young artists gave – after two years of deep research, intense preparation and hard work involving the whole village – birth to the contemporary art project CARAVAGGIO MMX.

Hi, I'm Giuseppe Zanoni, I was born in Porto Ercole, Tuscany, Italy in the 1970. When I was a child, I was very passionate about art and I started to draw. At the age of 12 years, a friend gave me a photocamera. Oh....love at first sight! It was amazing to discover the reality with this equipment and I started with the photography which then became my job.

In the 2004, with Annegriet Camilla Spoerndle and Giacomo Pietrapiana, I founded "Melograno", a No Profit Association with the goal to realize visual projects. Since 2004 the projects submitted to the local authorities are directed to the search for new forms of communication. This research, combined with the experience of Melograno members, led to the creation of new form of educational and cultural activities in the field of visual arts in our area.

In the 2008, we decided to investigate about the great painter Caravaggio.

CARAVAGGIO MMX – Homage to the great art rebel in 8 contemporary photographical reinterpretations

Yet in his lifetime CARAVAGGIO was known for his unconventional and epoch-making character – in his personality, relationships and in his art.

He lived a life like a real Bohemian, passing his time with (fe)male prostitutes, drugs and street fightings like a real rock’n’roll star and he caused a rumpus by integrating his flamboyant lifestyle in his artworks – by ignoring completely the classical idealism which dominated the whole art scene at his lifetime and by „highlighting“ his subjects as they really were – with all natural physical and emotional defects and a extreme dramatic use of lighting, which has never been seen before.

With the intent to pay tribute to this famous painter in the place where he died in his 400th anniversary of death, we developped 8 photographical reinterpretations of eight masterpieces of Caravaggio, based on the following guidelines:

  1. Caravaggio was a society observer.

What would have aroused his interest, when he was alive in 2010?

Our answer was: Problems you generally don't like talk about like teen and work problems, trash tv, family violence, MAFIA, AIDS, WAR

In 8 contemporary reinterpretations with the spirit of 2010, but maintaining dimension, light and composition of Caravaggio’s paintings.

  2. Caravaggio was a photographical painter.

But would he have even painted in 2010?

Our answer was: No, he would have used a photo camera, because Dr. Lapucci, Director of the Department of Restoration at the SACI Studio Art Centers International in Florence, associates Caravaggio’s painting technique with the origins of photography. So she demonstrated that he was using photosensitive material as base of his paintings just 400 years ago

Using a view camera on sheet films, scanned and printed on Hahnemühle best quality paper, without the infinite possibilities of digital photography and the virtuous tricks of digital post production. What you see, existed exactly like that in the studio. Not only the composition, the pose of the models and the objects, but even the incidence of light, the shadows of the protagonists, the chromatic graduation.

  3. Caravaggio felt himself close to the common people.

So would he have used professional models for his 2010 photographs?

Our answer was: No, he would’nt. He would have worked, as he did, with the simple people who surrounded and inspired him

The participation of Porto Ercole residents as protagonists of the photographs completes the temporal circle that began 400 years ago. Porto Ercole is no longer the place, where Caravaggio died, but also the place where his works - forever contemporary – have been revisited and continue to exist.

CARAVAGGIO MMX GOES TO FLORENCE - Exhibition at Medici Riccardi Palace, in May 2014

Rome, Naples, Milan and last, but not least the capital city of the region of Tuscany FLORENCE are on the to-do-list of every single CARAVAGGIO-tourist.

In the world famous Uffizi and the Foundation Roberto Longhi you can see a lots of famous CARAVAGGIO original paintings like Bacchus, Medusa and Portrait of Fra Antonio Martelli.

Presenting our artworks in this artistic and historical context of the city, where CARAVAGGIO’S spirit is still alive through his paintings, means a lot to us. Not only the visitors can directly compare the originals with our interpretations, but we can build a bridge between the present and the past.

We have the GREAT OPPORTUNITY to expose our work to a wideraging, international audience in the prestigious Medici Riccardi Palace in May 2014 - after the very successfull original exhibition of CARAVAGGIO MMX in July 2010 (13.000 visitors in a village that normally count only about 2.800 residents) in Porto Ercole, October 2010 in Palermo, and Grosseto in 2012.

The only problem: We can expose for free, but all the rest of the exhibition must be financed by ourselves.


CARAVAGGIO MMX AT FLORENCE – Desperately seeking funds for…

Money makes the world go around – unfortunately even in the world of art.

For the organization of the exhibition CARAVAGGIO MMX AT FLORENCE we need urgently funds to the amount of 5.510 €, consisting of:

  1. shipping and insurance of the artworks: 550 €

  2. advertising: 900 €

  3. preparation, inauguration and exhibition attendant: 1.600 €

  4. production and printing of the exibition catalogue: 2460 €

If we can’t achieve our goal, however the raised funds will enable us to have fewer expenses and to create new works with other contents. BUT: we are even happy about every non financial aid – so feel free to share and promote! We would love to see CARAVAGGIO MMX grow and to be continued – even outside Italy.

CARAVAGGIO MMX THANKS: YOU ! – What you see is what you get!

Nothing is for free. So: If you will support our ambitious art project, we will THANK YOU by:

  1. A personal thank you note on a post cards

  2. sending YOU a copy oft he CARAVAGGIO MMX catalogue

  3. giving YOU the chance to choose one of your favourite CARAVAGGIO MMX photo-artpiece, which we will send you as a limited edition print (20 x 30 cm – 30 x 40 cm – 50 x 70 cm – 70 x 100 cm)


CARAVAGGIO MMX & THE PERSONS BEHIND: MELOGRANO - non profit association presented by:

  1. Giuseppe Zanoni, photographer: www.giuseppezanoni.com

  2. Giacomo Pietrapiana, architect: www.arteficio.it

  3. Annegriet Camilla Spoerndle, art agent: www.kamillesk.de


CARAVAGGIO MMX MORE INFORMATION – get involved by a quick look on the original project’s catalogue

A picture is worth a thousand words. So if you want to see, what we have done until today, just have a quick look on the original project’s catalogue to get inspired, involved and enlightend: http://bit.ly/1hLeBaZ

For any further information feel free to contact us by mail:

Giuseppe: zanonilab@gmail.com

Giacomo: office@arteficio.it

Camilla: info@kamillesk.de

+++ THANK YOU +++ GRAZIE MILLE +++ VIELEN DANK +++ MUCHAS GRACIAS +++ MERCI +++


Giuseppe Zanoni
